For use with different languages and locales.

All callbacks must receive one value, an integer, and return a string.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The locale name. Should be a standard locale name such as en-GB, fr-FR, etc.

docblock.description: Provides more methods to fImage, most notably rotation based on EXIF data which may be present in the file.
docblock.long-description: Requires Flourish's fImage::determineProcessor() method to be made at least protected (at the moment it is private).

tag.name: copyright
tag.description: Copyright (c) 2012 bne1.

tag.name: author
tag.description: Andrew Udvare [au] <andrew@bne1.com>

docblock.description: Provides more methods to fImage, most notably rotation based on EXIF data which may be present in the file.
docblock.long-description: Requires Flourish's fImage::determineProcessor() method to be made at least protected (at the moment it is private).

tag.name: copyright
tag.description: Copyright (c) 2012 bne1.

tag.name: author
tag.description: Andrew Udvare [au] <andrew@bne1.com>

docblock.description: Rotation direction upside-up.
Rotation direction upside-down.
Rotation direction upside-left.
Rotation direction upside-right.
Flip direction horizontal.
Flip direction vertical.
Flip direction both ways.
No flip.
Flip the image in a specified direction. If PECL Imagick class is not found, GD will be used.
docblock.long-description: Unlike fImage, these changes are immediate.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: If Imagick fails to return data, or if an ImagickException is thrown.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: If no image processor is found; if the image type is invalid for GD. Additional notes: - To use ImageMagick (which is much faster), you must install the PECL Imagick extension. - PJPEG is not supported if GD is used. - This overwrites the data in the file before returning (this is NOT part of the operation queue). If the second argument is of internal type boolean, it will be treated as the $overwrite argument. The JPEG quality will be 90.

tag.name: param
tag.description: One of the FLIP_* constants.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Because this saves changes to the file directly, if the image is JPEG, specify a quality from 0 (worst quality) to 100 (best quality). Default is 90.

tag.name: param
tag.description: If the file should be overwritten.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Override the processor. Must be one of: 'imagemagick', 'gd'. This is generally for testing purposes only.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The image object, to allow method chaining. If $overwrite is FALSE, then a new sImage object is returned.

docblock.description: Rotate an image a certain way based on EXIF information embedded. Only JPEG and TIFF images are supported.
docblock.long-description: Unlike fImage, these changes are immediate.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: If the EXIF extension is not installed.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optional. One of the DIRECTION_* constant values. Default is up-side up.

tag.name: param
tag.description: If the file should be overwritten.

tag.name: param
tag.description: JPEG quality on a scale from 0 to 100.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Object to allow method chaining. If $overwrite is FALSE, then a new sImage object is returned.

docblock.description: Utility functions for timestamp and time/date/time zone representations.

tag.name: copyright
tag.description: Copyright (c) 2012 bne1.

tag.name: author
tag.description: Andrew Udvare [au] <andrew@bne1.com>

docblock.description: Loose regular expression to match timestamp as defined by W3C for HTML 5 date/datetime fields. The main difference is allowing for a space between the date and the literal 'T'.
Get a formatted timezone string such as +08:00 from 8 or -12:00 from -12.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The timezone, can be decimal.

tag.name: return
tag.description: String, such as +08:00.

docblock.description: Convert an RFC3339 (HTML 5 version) timestamp to UNIX. Timezone is ignored.
docblock.long-description: HTML 5 mandates 2 extra constraints: - the literal letters T and Z in the date/time syntax must always be uppercase - the date-fullyear production is instead defined as four or more digits representing a number greater than 0

tag.name: throws
tag.description: If $throw is set to TRUE and the timestamp is invalid.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Throw an fValidationException if the timestamp is is invalid. Defaults to FALSE.

tag.name: return
tag.description: UNIX timestamp or boolean FALSE. If FALSE is returned, the string was invalid.

The fDatabase instance.

docblock.description: Get the site database instance. This is useful for getting database information or using SQL queries with methods such as translatedExcecute.
docblock.long-description: This method can also be used to configure fORM if that is desired.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The fDatabase instance.

docblock.description: Configures session settings.
Configures authorisation.
Example entry point. This would be called from index.php or similar file.
docblock.long-description:
Calls to set up the database, configure session, configure authorisation, and set up the exception handler.

After these calls, it's expected that the template (sTemplate) will be set up and that a router (such as Moor) will be used to continue the request.

docblock.description:
Some tags require end tags while some others do not. Example:

does not in HTML, but in XHTML like all tags requires an end tag. However, some browsers are not going to do the same thing when encountering several

tags with no endings, so it returns TRUE.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Tag name.

tag.name: return
tag.description: TRUE if the end tag is required, FALSE otherwise.

tag.description: Content to place within HTML. If the tag never uses an end tag, this parameter will be ignored. In particular, <input>, <link> and similar tags.

tag.description: HTML tag, ready to be displayed.

tag.name: changes

tag.name: changes

tag.name: changes

tag.name: changes

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b3 Fixed a bug with ::printMessage() messing up some HTML messages [wb, 2009-03-27]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b2 ::compose() more robustly handles `$components` passed as an array, ::__construct() now detects stray `%` characters [wb, 2009-02-05]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b The initial implementation [wb, 2007-06-14]

docblock.description: Creates a string representation of any variable using predefined strings for booleans, `NULL` and empty strings
docblock.long-description:
The string output format of this method is very similar to the output of [http://php.net/print_r print_r()] except that the following values are represented as special strings:

  • TRUE: '{true}'
  • FALSE: '{false}'
  • NULL: '{null}'
  • '': '{empty_string}'

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value to dump

tag.name: return
tag.description: The string representation of the value

docblock.description: Sets the message for the exception, allowing for string interpolation and internationalization
docblock.long-description:
The $message can contain any number of formatting placeholders for string and number interpolation via [http://php.net/sprintf sprintf()]. Any % signs that do not appear to be part of a valid formatting placeholder will be automatically escaped with a second %.

The following aspects of valid sprintf() formatting codes are not accepted since they are redundant and restrict the non-formatting use of the % sign in exception messages: - % 2d: Using a literal space as a padding character - a space will be used if no padding character is specified - %'.d: Providing a padding character but no width - no padding will be applied without a width

tag.name: param
tag.description: The message for the exception. This accepts a subset of [http://php.net/sprintf `sprintf()`] strings - see method description for more details.

tag.name: param
tag.description: A string or number to insert into the message

tag.name: param
tag.description: The exception code to set

docblock.description: Allows the message to be overwriten

tag.name: param
tag.description: The new message for the exception

docblock.description: Splits an exception with an HTML list into multiple strings each containing part of the original message
docblock.long-description:
This method should be called with two or more parameters of arrays of string to match. If any of the provided strings are matching in a list item in the exception message, a new copy of the message will be created containing just the matching list items.

Here is an exception message to be split:

{{{

!html

The following problems were found:

  • First Name: Please enter a value
  • Last Name: Please enter a value
  • Email: Please enter a value
  • Address: Please enter a value
  • City: Please enter a value
  • State: Please enter a value
  • Zip Code: Please enter a value

}}}

The following PHP would split the exception into two messages:

{{{

!php

list ($name_exception, $address_exception) = $exception->splitMessage( array('First Name', 'Last Name', 'Email'), array('Address', 'City', 'State', 'Zip Code') ); }}}

The resulting messages would be:

{{{

!html

The following problems were found:

  • First Name: Please enter a value
  • Last Name: Please enter a value
  • Email: Please enter a value

}}}

and

{{{

!html

The following problems were found:

  • Address: Please enter a value
  • City: Please enter a value
  • State: Please enter a value
  • Zip Code: Please enter a value

}}}

If no list items match the strings in a parameter, the result will be an empty string, allowing for simple display:

{{{

!php

fHTML::show($name_exception, 'error'); }}}

An empty string is returned when none of the list items matched the strings in the parameter. If no list items are found, the first value in the returned array will be the existing message and all other array values will be an empty string.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of strings to filter the list items by, list items will be ordered in the same order as this array

tag.name: return
tag.description: This will contain an array of strings corresponding to the parameters passed - see method description for details

docblock.description: Redirects to the URL specified, without requiring a full-qualified URL
docblock.long-description:
• If the URL starts with /, it is treated as an absolute path on the current site
    • If the URL starts with http:// or https://, it is treated as a fully-qualified URL
    • If the URL starts with anything else, including a ?, it is appended to the current URL
    • If the URL is ommitted, it is treated as the current URL

tag.name: param
tag.description: The url to redirect to

tag.name: author

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b24 Backwards Compatibility Break - moved ::detectOpcodeCache() to fLoader::hasOpcodeCache() [wb, 2011-08-26]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b23 Backwards Compatibility Break - changed the email subject of error/exception emails to include relevant file info, instead of the timestamp, for better email message threading [wb, 2011-06-20]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b22 Fixed a bug with dumping arrays containing integers [wb, 2011-05-26]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b21 Changed ::startErrorCapture() to allow "stacking" it via multiple calls, fixed a couple of bugs with ::dump() mangling strings in the form `int(1)`, fixed mispelling of `occurred` [wb, 2011-05-09]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b20 Backwards Compatibility Break - Updated ::expose() to not wrap the data in HTML when running via CLI, and instead just append a newline [wb, 2011-02-24]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b19 Added detection of AIX to ::checkOS() [wb, 2011-01-19]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b18 Updated ::expose() to be able to accept multiple parameters [wb, 2011-01-10]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b17 Fixed a bug with ::backtrace() triggering notices when an argument is not UTF-8 [wb, 2010-08-17]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b16 Added the `$types` and `$regex` parameters to ::startErrorCapture() and the `$regex` parameter to ::stopErrorCapture() [wb, 2010-08-09]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b15 Added ::startErrorCapture() and ::stopErrorCapture() [wb, 2010-07-05]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b14 Changed ::enableExceptionHandling() to only call fException::printMessage() when the destination is not `html` and no callback has been defined, added ::configureSMTP() to allow using fSMTP for error and exception emails [wb, 2010-06-04]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b13 Added the `$backtrace` parameter to ::backtrace() [wb, 2010-03-05]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b12 Added ::getDebug() to check for the global debugging flag, added more specific BSD checks to ::checkOS() [wb, 2010-03-02]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b11 Added ::detectOpcodeCache() [nt+wb, 2009-10-06]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b10 Fixed ::expose() to properly display when output includes non-UTF-8 binary data [wb, 2009-06-29]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b9 Added ::disableContext() to remove context info for exception/error handling, tweaked output for exceptions/errors [wb, 2009-06-28]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b8 ::enableErrorHandling() and ::enableExceptionHandling() now accept multiple email addresses, and a much wider range of emails [wb-imarc, 2009-06-01]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b7 ::backtrace() now properly replaces document root with {doc_root} on Windows [wb, 2009-05-02]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b6 Fixed a bug with getting the server name for error messages when running on the command line [wb, 2009-03-11]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b5 Fixed a bug with checking the error/exception destination when a log file is specified [wb, 2009-03-07]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b4 Backwards compatibility break - ::getOS() and ::getPHPVersion() removed, replaced with ::checkOS() and ::checkVersion() [wb, 2009-02-16]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b3 ::handleError() now displays what kind of error occurred as the heading [wb, 2009-02-15]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b2 Added ::registerDebugCallback() [wb, 2009-02-07]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b The initial implementation [wb, 2007-09-25]

The email address to send error emails from
Creates a nicely formatted backtrace to the the point where this method is called

docblock.description: Performs a [http://php.net/call_user_func call_user_func()], while translating PHP 5.2 static callback syntax for PHP 5.1 and 5.0
docblock.long-description:
Parameters can be passed either as a single array of parameters or as multiple parameters.

{{{

!php

// Passing multiple parameters in a normal fashion fCore::call('Class::method', TRUE, 0, 'test');

// Passing multiple parameters in a parameters array fCore::call('Class::method', array(TRUE, 0, 'test')); }}}

To pass parameters by reference they must be assigned to an array by reference and the function/method being called must accept those parameters by reference. If either condition is not met, the parameter will be passed by value.

{{{

!php

// Passing parameters by reference fCore::call('Class::method', array(&$var1, &$var2)); }}}

tag.name: param
tag.description: The function or method to call

tag.name: param
tag.description: The parameters to pass to the function/method

tag.name: return
tag.description: The return value of the called function/method

docblock.description: Translates a Class::method style static method callback to array style for compatibility with PHP 5.0 and 5.1 and built-in PHP functions

tag.name: param
tag.description: The callback to translate

tag.name: return
tag.description: The translated callback

tag.description: The debug message

tag.description: If debugging should be forced even when global debugging is off

docblock.description: Creates a string representation of any variable using predefined strings for booleans, `NULL` and empty strings
docblock.long-description:
The string output format of this method is very similar to the output of [http://php.net/print_r print_r()] except that the following values are represented as special strings:

  • TRUE: '{true}'
  • FALSE: '{false}'
  • NULL: '{null}'
  • '': '{empty_string}'

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value to dump

tag.name: return
tag.description: The string representation of the value

docblock.description: Disables including the context information with exception and error messages
docblock.long-description:
The context information includes the following superglobals:

  • $_SERVER
  • $_POST
  • $_GET
  • $_SESSION
  • $_FILES
  • $_COOKIE

docblock.description: Enables debug messages globally, i.e. they will be shown for any call to ::debug()

tag.name: param
tag.description: If debugging messages should be shown

docblock.description: Turns on a feature where undefined constants are automatically created with the string value equivalent to the name
docblock.long-description: This functionality only works if ::enableErrorHandling() has been called first. This functionality may have a very slight performance impact since a E_STRICT error message must be captured and then a call to [http://php.net/define define()] is made.

docblock.description: Turns on developer-friendly error handling that includes context information including a backtrace and superglobal dumps
docblock.long-description:
All errors that match the current [http://php.net/error_reporting error_reporting()] level will be redirected to the destination and will include a full backtrace. In addition, dumps of the following superglobals will be made to aid in debugging:

  • $_SERVER
  • $_POST
  • $_GET
  • $_SESSION
  • $_FILES
  • $_COOKIE

The superglobal dumps are only done once per page, however a backtrace in included for each error.

If an email address is specified for the destination, only one email will be sent per script execution. If both error and [enableExceptionHandling() exception handling] are set to the same email address, the email will contain both errors and exceptions.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The destination for the errors and context information - an email address, a file path or the string `'html'`

docblock.description: Turns on developer-friendly uncaught exception handling that includes context information including a backtrace and superglobal dumps
docblock.long-description:
Any uncaught exception will be redirected to the destination specified, and the page will execute the $closing_code callback before exiting. The destination will receive a message with the exception messaage, a full backtrace and dumps of the following superglobals to aid in debugging:

  • $_SERVER
  • $_POST
  • $_GET
  • $_SESSION
  • $_FILES
  • $_COOKIE

The superglobal dumps are only done once per page, however a backtrace in included for each error.

If an email address is specified for the destination, only one email will be sent per script execution.

If an email address is specified for the destination, only one email will be sent per script execution. If both exception and [enableErrorHandling() error handling] are set to the same email address, the email will contain both exceptions and errors.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The destination for the exception and context information - an email address, a file path or the string `'html'`

tag.name: param
tag.description: This callback will happen after the exception is handled and before page execution stops. Good for printing a footer. If no callback is provided and the exception extends fException, fException::printMessage() will be called.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The parameters to send to `$closing_code`

docblock.description: Prints the ::dump() of a value
docblock.long-description:
The dump will be printed in a <pre> tag with the class exposed if PHP is running anywhere but via the command line (cli). If PHP is running via the cli, the data will be printed, followed by a single line break (\n).

If multiple parameters are passed, they are exposed as an array.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value to show

docblock.description: Generates some information about the context of an error or exception

tag.name: return
tag.description: A string containing `$_SERVER`, `$_GET`, `$_POST`, `$_FILES`, `$_SESSION` and `$_COOKIE`

docblock.description: Changed the session to use a time-based cookie instead of a session-based cookie
docblock.long-description:
The length of the time-based cookie is controlled by ::setLength(). When this method is called, a time-based cookie is used to store the session ID. This means the session can persist browser restarts. Normally, a session-based cookie is used, which is wiped when a browser restart occurs.

This method should be called during the login process and will normally be controlled by a checkbox or similar where the user can indicate if they want to stay logged in for an extended period of time.

docblock.description: Callback to garbage-collect the session cache

tag.name: return
tag.description: If the operation succeeded

tag.name: return
tag.description: The data element requested

docblock.description: Sets an fCache object to store sessions in
docblock.long-description:
While any type of fCache backend should technically work, it would be unwise to use the file and directory types. The file caching backend stores all values in a single file, which would quickly become a performance bottleneck and could cause data loss with many concurrent users. The directory caching backend would not make sense since it is the same general functionality as the default session handler, but it would be slightly slower since it is written in PHP and not C.

It is recommended to set the serializer and unserializer $config settings on the fCache object to string for the best performance and minimal storage space.

For better performance, check out using the built-in session handlers that are bundled with the following extensions:

  • [http://php.net/memcached.sessions memcached]
  • [http://php.net/memcache.examples-overview#example-3596 memcache]
  • [https://github.com/nicolasff/phpredis redis]

The [http://pecl.php.net/package/igbinary igbinary] extension can provide even more of a performance boost by storing serialized data in binary format instead of as text.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An fCache object to store session values in

tag.name: param
tag.description: A prefix to add to all session IDs before storing them in the cache

docblock.description: Sets the minimum length of a session - PHP might not clean up the session data right away once this timespan has elapsed
docblock.long-description:
Please be sure to set a custom session path via ::setPath() to ensure another site on the server does not garbage collect the session files from this site!

Both of the timespan can accept either a integer timespan in seconds, or an english description of a timespan (e.g. '30 minutes', '1 hour', '1 day 2 hours').

tag.name: param
tag.description: The normal, session-based cookie, length for the session

tag.name: param
tag.description: The persistent, timed-based cookie, length for the session - this is enabled by calling ::enabledPersistence() during login

docblock.description: Sets the path to store session files in
docblock.long-description:
This method should always be called with a non-standard directory whenever ::setLength() is called to ensure that another site on the server does not garbage collect the session files for this site.

Standard session directories usually include /tmp and /var/tmp.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The directory to store session files in

docblock.description: Callback to write a session's values

tag.name: param
tag.description: The session to write

tag.name: param
tag.description: The serialized values

tag.name: return
tag.description: The session's serialized data

docblock.description: Callbacks for when messages are composed
Performs an [http://php.net/sprintf sprintf()] on a string and provides a hook for modifications such as internationalization

tag.name: param
tag.description: A message to compose

tag.name: param
tag.description: A string or number to insert into the message

tag.name: return
tag.description: The composed message

docblock.description: Adds a callback for when a message is created using ::compose()
docblock.long-description:
The primary purpose of these callbacks is for internationalization of error messaging in Flourish. The callback should accept a single parameter, the message being composed and should return the message with any modifications.

The timing parameter controls if the callback happens before or after the actual composition takes place, which is simply a call to [http://php.net/sprintf sprintf()]. Thus the message passed 'pre' will always be exactly the same, while the message 'post' will include the interpolated variables. Because of this, most of the time the 'pre' timing should be chosen.

tag.name: param
tag.description: When the callback should be executed - `'pre'` or `'post'` performing the actual composition

tag.name: param
tag.description: The callback

docblock.description: Starts a filesystem pseudo-transaction, should only be called when no transaction is in progress.
docblock.long-description: Flourish filesystem transactions are NOT full ACID-compliant transactions, but rather more of an filesystem undo buffer which can return the filesystem to the state when ::begin() was called. If your PHP script dies in the middle of an operation this functionality will do nothing for you and all operations will be retained, except for deletes which only occur once the transaction is committed.

docblock.description: Commits a filesystem transaction, should only be called when a transaction is in progress

docblock.description: The available filters to use in templates

property.name: $templates
property.default:
array( 'default' => array( 'type' => 'without_first_last', 'size' => 4, 'pieces' => array( 'info' => '
Page {{ page }} of {{ total_records }} items
', 'start' => '
    ', 'prev' => '
  • Prev
    • ', 'prev_disabled' => '', 'page' => '
  • {{ page }}
    • ', 'next' => '
  • Next
    • ', 'next_disabled' => '', 'end' => '
' ) ) )

docblock.description: The available templates to use for a paginator
Extra data for the templates
The page number
The number of records per page
The total number of records
Defines a new template to use with the paginator
docblock.long-description:
The $pieces array must contain the following array keys:

  • info: the template to use when calling the printInfo() method
  • start: the template to start the page list with
  • prev: the template for the previous link
  • prev_disabled: the template for the previous link, when disabled
  • page: the template for a single page link
  • separator: the template for the separator to use when the type is with_first_last
  • next: the template for the next link
  • next_disabled: the template for the next link, when disabled
  • end: the template to end the page list with

There are various pre-defined variables available for use in the template pieces. These variables are printed by using the syntax {{ variable }}.

The info, start and end pieces may use the following variables:

  • page: the page of records being shown
  • total_pages: the total number of pages of records
  • first_record: the record number of the first record being shown
  • last_record: the record number of the last record being shown
  • total_records: the total number of records being paginated

The prev and next pieces may use the following variables:

  • page: the page number of the page of results being linked to
  • url: the URL of the page being linked to

The page piece may use the following variables:

  • page: the page number of the page being linked to
  • url: the URL of the page being linked to
  • first: the string "first" if the link is to the first page
  • last: the string "last" if the link is to the last page
  • current: the string "current" if the link is to the current page

The separator piece does not have access to any pre-defined variables.

In addition to the pre-defined variables, it is possible to add any other variables to be used in any of the pieces by calling the instance method ::set().

It is possible to use variable filters on a variable to modify it. The most common variable to filter would be name. To filter a variable, add a | and the filter name after the variable name, in the form {{ variable|filter }}. The following filters are available:

  • inflect: if the total number of records is not 1, pluralize the variable - this only works for nouns
  • lower: converts the contents of the variable to lower case
  • url_encode: encode the value for inclusion in a URL
  • humanize: converts a underscore_notation or CamelCase string to a string with spaces between words and in Title Caps

Filters can be combined, in which case they are list one after the other in the form {{ variable|filter_1|filter_2 }}.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the template

tag.name: param
tag.description: The type of pagination: `without_first_last` or `with_first_last` - `with_first_last` always includes links to the first and last pages

tag.name: param
tag.description: The number of pages to show on either side of the current page

tag.name: param
tag.description: The chunks of HTML to create the paginator from - see method description for details

docblock.description: Sets the maximum size the uploaded file may be
docblock.long-description:
This method should be used with the [http://php.net/file-upload.post-method MAX_FILE_SIZE] hidden form input since the hidden form input will reject a file that is too large before the file completely uploads, while this method will wait until the whole file has been uploaded. This method should always be used since it is very easy for the MAX_FILE_SIZE post field to be manipulated on the client side.

This method can only further restrict the [http://php.net/upload_max_filesize upload_max_filesize ini setting], it can not increase that setting. upload_max_filesize must be set in the php.ini (or an Apache configuration) since file uploads are handled before the request is handed off to PHP.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The maximum file size (e.g. `1MB`, `200K`, `10.5M`) - `0` for no limit

docblock.description: Sets a column to be a file upload column
docblock.long-description:
Configuring a column to be a file upload column means that whenever fActiveRecord::populate() is called for an fActiveRecord object, any appropriately named file uploads (via $_FILES) will be moved into the directory for this column.

Setting the column to a file path will cause the specified file to be copied into the directory for this column.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The class name or instance of the class

tag.name: param
tag.description: The column to set as a file upload column

tag.name: param
tag.description: The directory to upload/move to

docblock.description: Sets a column to be an image upload column
docblock.long-description:
This method works exactly the same as ::configureFileUploadColumn() except that only image files are accepted.

To alter an image, including the file type, use ::addFImageMethodCall().

tag.name: param
tag.description: The class name or instance of the class

tag.name: param
tag.description: The column to set as a file upload column

tag.name: param
tag.description: The directory to upload to

docblock.description: The cache configuration, used for database, directory and file caches
docblock.long-description:
The array structure for database caches is: {{{ array( 'table' => (string) {the database table to use}, 'key_column' => (string) {the varchar column to store the key in, should be able to handle at least 250 characters}, 'value_column' => (string) {the text/varchar column to store the value in}, 'ttl_column' => (string) {the integer column to store the expiration time in} ) }}}

The array structure for directory caches: {{{ array( 'path' => (string) {the directory path with trailing slash} ) }}}

The array structure for file caches: {{{ array( 'path' => (string) {the file path}, 'state' => (string) {clean or dirty, used to appropriately save} ) }}}

docblock.description: The data store to use
docblock.long-description:
Either the: - array structure for file cache - Memcache or Memcached object for memcache - fDatabase object for database - Redis object for redis

Not used for apc, directory or xcache

docblock.description: The type of cache
docblock.long-description: The valid values are: - 'apc' - 'database' - 'directory' - 'file' - 'memcache' - 'redis' - 'xcache'

docblock.description: Set the type and master key for the cache
docblock.long-description:
A file cache uses a single file to store values in an associative array and is probably not suitable for a large number of keys.

Using an apc or xcache cache will have far better performance than a file or directory, however please remember that keys are shared server-wide.

$config is an associative array of configuration options for the various backends. Some backend require additional configuration, while others provide provide optional settings.

The following $config options must be set for the database backend:

  • table: The database table to use for caching
  • key_column: The column to store the cache key in - must support at least 250 character strings
  • value_column: The column to store the serialized value in - this should probably be a TEXT column to support large values, or BLOB if binary serialization is used
  • value_data_type: If a BLOB column is being used for the value_column, this should be set to 'blob', otherwise string
  • ttl_column: The column to store the expiration timestamp of the cached entry - this should be an integer

The following $config for the following items can be set for all backends:

  • serializer: A callback to serialize data with, defaults to the PHP function serialize()
  • unserializer: A callback to unserialize data with, defaults to the PHP function unserialize()

Common serialization callbacks include:

  • json_encode/json_decode
  • igbinary_serialize/igbinary_unserialize

Please note that using JSON for serialization will exclude all non-public properties of objects from being serialized.

A custom serialize and unserialze option is string, which will cast all values to a string when storing, instead of serializing them. If a __toString() method is provided for objects, it will be called.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The type of caching to use: `'apc'`, `'database'`, `'directory'`, `'file'`, `'memcache'`, `'redis'`, `'xcache'`

tag.name: param
tag.description: The path for a `file` or `directory` cache, an `Memcache` or `Memcached` object for a `memcache` cache, an fDatabase object for a `database` cache or a `Redis` object for a `redis` cache - not used for `apc` or `xcache`

tag.name: param
tag.description: Configuration options - see method description for details

docblock.description: Parses a MIME message into an associative array of information
docblock.long-description:
The output includes the following keys:

  • 'received': The date the message was received by the server
  • 'headers': An associative array of mail headers, the keys are the header names, in lowercase

And one or more of the following:

  • 'text': The plaintext body
  • 'html': The HTML body
  • 'attachment': An array of attachments, each containing:
    • 'filename': The name of the file
    • 'mimetype': The mimetype of the file
    • 'data': The raw contents of the file
  • 'inline': An array of inline files, each containing:
    • 'filename': The name of the file
    • 'mimetype': The mimetype of the file
    • 'data': The raw contents of the file
  • 'related': An associative array of related files, such as embedded images, with the key 'cid:{content-id}' and an array value containing:
    • 'mimetype': The mimetype of the file
    • 'data': The raw contents of the file
  • 'verified': If the message contents were verified via an S/MIME certificate - if not verified the smime.p7s will be listed as an attachment
  • 'decrypted': If the message contents were decrypted via an S/MIME private key - if not decrypted the smime.p7m will be listed as an attachment

All values in headers, text and body will have been decoded to UTF-8. Files in the attachment, inline and related array will all retain their original encodings.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The full source of the email message

tag.name: param
tag.description: If `\r\n` should be converted to `\n` in the `text` and `html` parts the message

tag.name: return
tag.description: The parsed email message - see method description for details

docblock.description: Retrieves a single message from the server
docblock.long-description:
The output includes the following keys:

  • 'uid': The UID of the message
  • 'received': The date the message was received by the server
  • 'headers': An associative array of mail headers, the keys are the header names, in lowercase

And one or more of the following:

  • 'text': The plaintext body
  • 'html': The HTML body
  • 'attachment': An array of attachments, each containing:
    • 'filename': The name of the file
    • 'mimetype': The mimetype of the file
    • 'data': The raw contents of the file
  • 'inline': An array of inline files, each containing:
    • 'filename': The name of the file
    • 'mimetype': The mimetype of the file
    • 'data': The raw contents of the file
  • 'related': An associative array of related files, such as embedded images, with the key 'cid:{content-id}' and an array value containing:
    • 'mimetype': The mimetype of the file
    • 'data': The raw contents of the file
  • 'verified': If the message contents were verified via an S/MIME certificate - if not verified the smime.p7s will be listed as an attachment
  • 'decrypted': If the message contents were decrypted via an S/MIME private key - if not decrypted the smime.p7m will be listed as an attachment

All values in headers, text and body will have been decoded to UTF-8. Files in the attachment, inline and related array will all retain their original encodings.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The UID of the message to retrieve

tag.name: param
tag.description: If `\r\n` should be converted to `\n` in the `text` and `html` parts the message

tag.name: return
tag.description: The parsed email message - see method description for details

docblock.description: Gets a list of messages from the server
docblock.long-description:
The structure of the returned array is:

{{{ array( (integer) {uid} => array( 'uid' => (integer) {a unique identifier for this message on this server}, 'received' => (string) {date message was received}, 'size' => (integer) {size of message in bytes}, 'date' => (string) {date message was sent}, 'from' => (string) {the from header value}, 'subject' => (string) {the message subject}, 'message_id' => (string) {optional - the message-id header value, should be globally unique}, 'to' => (string) {optional - the to header value}, 'in_reply_to' => (string) {optional - the in-reply-to header value} ), ... ) }}}

All values will have been decoded to UTF-8.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The number of messages to retrieve

tag.name: param
tag.description: The page of messages to retrieve

tag.name: return
tag.description: A list of messages on the server - see method description for details

docblock.description: Accepts a CREATE TABLE statement and parses out the column definitions
docblock.long-description: The return value is an associative array with the keys being column names and the values being arrays containing the following keys: - definition: (string) the complete column definition - pieces: (array) an associative array that can be joined back together to make the definition - beginning - column_name - data_type - not_null - null - default - unique - primary_key - check_constraint - foreign_key - deferrable - comment/end

tag.name: param
tag.description: The SQL `CREATE TABLE` statement

tag.name: return
tag.description: An associative array of information for each column - see method description for details

docblock.description: Provides cryptography functionality, including hashing, symmetric-key encryption and public-key encryption

tag.name: copyright

tag.name: author
tag.description: Will Bond [wb] <will@flourishlib.com>

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b14 Added the `base36`, `base56` and custom types to ::randomString() [wb, 2011-08-25]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b13 Updated documentation about symmetric-key encryption to explicitly state block and key sizes, added base64 type to ::randomString() [wb, 2010-11-06]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b12 Fixed an inline comment that incorrectly references AES-256 [wb, 2010-11-04]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b11 Updated class to use fCore::startErrorCapture() instead of `error_reporting()` [wb, 2010-08-09]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b10 Added a missing parameter to an fProgrammerException in ::randomString() [wb, 2010-07-29]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b9 Added ::hashHMAC() [wb, 2010-04-20]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b8 Fixed ::seedRandom() to pass a directory instead of a file to [http://php.net/disk_free_space `disk_free_space()`] [wb, 2010-03-09]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b7 SECURITY FIX: fixed issue with ::random() and ::randomString() not producing random output on OSX, made ::seedRandom() more robust [wb, 2009-10-06]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b6 Changed ::symmetricKeyEncrypt() to throw an fValidationException when the $secret_key is less than 8 characters [wb, 2009-09-30]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b5 Fixed a bug where some windows machines would throw an exception when generating random strings or numbers [wb, 2009-06-09]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b4 Updated for new fCore API [wb, 2009-02-16]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b3 Changed @ error suppression operator to `error_reporting()` calls [wb, 2009-01-26]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b2 Backwards compatibility break - changed ::symmetricKeyEncrypt() to not encrypt the IV since we are using HMAC on it [wb, 2009-01-26]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b The initial implementation [wb, 2007-11-27]

docblock.description: Decrypts ciphertext encrypted using public-key encryption via ::publicKeyEncrypt()
docblock.long-description: A public key (X.509 certificate) is required for encryption and a private key (PEM) is required for decryption.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: When the ciphertext appears to be corrupted

tag.name: param
tag.description: The content to be decrypted

tag.name: param
tag.description: The path to a PEM-encoded private key

tag.name: param
tag.description: The password for the private key

tag.name: return
tag.description: The decrypted plaintext

docblock.description: Encrypts the passed data using public key encryption via OpenSSL
docblock.long-description: A public key (X.509 certificate) is required for encryption and a private key (PEM) is required for decryption.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The content to be encrypted

tag.name: param
tag.description: The path to an X.509 public key certificate

tag.name: return
tag.description: A base-64 encoded result containing a Flourish fingerprint and suitable for decryption using ::publicKeyDecrypt()

docblock.description: Creates a signature for plaintext to allow verification of the creator
docblock.long-description: A private key (PEM) is required for signing and a public key (X.509 certificate) is required for verification.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: When the private key is invalid

tag.name: param
tag.description: The content to be signed

tag.name: param
tag.description: The path to a PEM-encoded private key

tag.name: param
tag.description: The password for the private key

tag.name: return
tag.description: The base64-encoded signature suitable for verification using ::publicKeyVerify()

docblock.description: Checks a signature for plaintext to verify the creator - works with ::publicKeySign()
docblock.long-description: A private key (PEM) is required for signing and a public key (X.509 certificate) is required for verification.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The content to check

tag.name: param
tag.description: The base64-encoded signature for the plaintext

tag.name: param
tag.description: The path to an X.509 public key certificate

tag.name: return
tag.description: If the public key file is the public key of the user who signed the plaintext

docblock.long-description: Since this is symmetric-key cryptography, the same key is used for encryption and decryption.

tag.name: throws

tag.description: The content to be encrypted

tag.description: The secret key to use for encryption - must be at least 8 characters

tag.description: An encrypted and base-64 encoded result containing a Flourish fingerprint and suitable for decryption using ::symmetricKeyDecrypt()

tag.name: changes

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b34 Updated the class to work with fixes in fORMRelated [wb, 2010-07-22]

tag.name: changes

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b31 Fixed ::reflect() to properly show parameters for associate methods [wb, 2010-06-08]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b30 Fixed a bug where related record error messages could be overwritten if there were multiple related records with the same error [wb, 2010-05-29]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b28 Updated ::associateRecords() to accept just a single fActiveRecord [wb, 2010-05-06]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b27 Updated the class to force configure classes before peforming actions with them [wb, 2010-03-30]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b26 Fixed ::reflect() to show the proper return values for `associate`, `link` and `populate` methods [wb, 2010-03-15]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b25 Fixed a bug when storing a one-to-one related record with different column names on each end of the relationship [wb, 2010-03-04]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b24 Added the ability to associate a single record via primary key [wb, 2010-03-03]

tag.description: 1.0.0b23 Fixed a column aliasing issue with SQLite [wb, 2010-01-25]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b22 Fixed a bug with associating a non-contiguous array of fActiveRecord objects [wb, 2009-12-17]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b21 Added support for the $force_cascade parameter of fActiveRecord::store(), added ::hasRecords() and fixed a bug with creating non-existent one-to-one related records [wb, 2009-12-16]

tag.description: 1.0.0b20 Updated code for the new fORMDatabase and fORMSchema APIs [wb, 2009-10-28]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b19 Internal Backwards Compatibility Break - Added the `$class` parameter to ::storeManyToMany() - also fixed ::countRecords() to work across all databases, changed SQL statements to use value placeholders, identifier escaping and support schemas [wb, 2009-10-22]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b18 Fixed a bug in ::countRecords() that would occur when multiple routes existed to the table being counted [wb, 2009-10-05]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b17 Updated code for new fRecordSet API [wb, 2009-09-16]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b16 Fixed a bug with ::createRecord() not creating non-existent record when the related value is NULL [wb, 2009-08-25]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b15 Fixed a bug with ::createRecord() where foreign keys with a different column and related column name would not load properly [wb, 2009-08-17]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b14 Fixed a bug with ::createRecord() when a foreign key constraint is on a column other than the primary key [wb, 2009-08-10]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b13 ::setOrderBys() now (properly) only recognizes *-to-many relationships [wb, 2009-07-31]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b12 Changed how related record values are set and how related validation messages are ignored because of recursive relationships [wb, 2009-07-29]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b11 Fixed some bugs with one-to-one relationships [wb, 2009-07-21]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b10 Fixed a couple of bugs with validating related records [wb, 2009-06-26]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b9 Fixed a bug where ::store() would not save associations with no related records [wb, 2009-06-23]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b8 Changed ::associateRecords() to work for *-to-many instead of just many-to-many relationships [wb, 2009-06-17]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b7 Updated code for new fORM API, fixed API documentation bugs [wb, 2009-06-15]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b6 Updated code to use new fValidationException::formatField() method [wb, 2009-06-04]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b5 Added ::getPrimaryKeys() and ::setPrimaryKeys(), renamed ::setRecords() to ::setRecordSet() and ::tallyRecords() to ::setCount() [wb, 2009-06-02]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b4 Updated code to handle new association method for related records and new `$related_records` structure, added ::store() and ::validate() [wb, 2009-06-02]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b3 ::associateRecords() can now accept an array of records or primary keys instead of only an fRecordSet [wb, 2009-06-01]

tag.name: changes

Provides string functions for UTF-8 strings
docblock.long-description: This class is implemented to provide a UTF-8 version of almost every built-in PHP string function. For more information about UTF-8, please visit http://flourishlib.com/docs/UTF-8.

docblock.description: Depending how things are compiled, NetBSD and Solaris don't support //IGNORE in iconv()
docblock.long-description: If //IGNORE support is not provided strings with invalid characters will be truncated

docblock.description: All lowercase UTF-8 characters mapped to uppercase characters
All lowercase UTF-8 characters not properly handled by [http://php.net/mb_strtoupper mb_strtoupper()] mapped to uppercase characters
All uppercase UTF-8 characters not properly handled by [http://php.net/mb_strtolower mb_strtolower()] mapped to lowercase characters
All uppercase UTF-8 characters mapped to lowercase characters
A mapping of all ASCII-based latin characters, puntuation, symbols and number forms to ASCII.
docblock.long-description:
Includes elements form the following unicode blocks:

  • Latin-1 Supplement
  • Latin Extended-A
  • Latin Extended-B
  • IPA Extensions
  • Latin Extended Additional
  • General Punctuation
  • Letterlike symbols
  • Number Forms

docblock.description: If the [http://php.net/mbstring mbstring] extension is available
Maps UTF-8 ASCII-based latin characters, puntuation, symbols and number forms to ASCII
docblock.long-description:
Any characters or symbols that can not be translated will be removed.

This function is most useful for situation that only allows ASCII, such as in URLs.

Translates elements form the following unicode blocks:

  • Latin-1 Supplement
  • Latin Extended-A
  • Latin Extended-B
  • IPA Extensions
  • Latin Extended Additional
  • General Punctuation
  • Letterlike symbols
  • Number Forms

tag.name: param
tag.description: The string to convert

tag.name: return
tag.description: The input string in pure ASCII

tag.name: param
tag.description: The second string to compare

tag.name: param
tag.description: The first string to compare

tag.name: param
tag.description: The second string to compare

docblock.description: Compares strings using a natural order algorithm in a case-insensitive manner, with the resulting order having latin characters that are based on ASCII letters placed after the relative ASCII characters
docblock.long-description: Please note that this function sorts based on English language sorting rules only. Locale-sepcific sorting is done by [http://php.net/strcoll strcoll()], however there are technical limitations.

tag.description: The second string to compare

docblock.description: Prints a sortable column header `a` tag
docblock.long-description:
The a tag will include the CSS class 'sortable_column' and the direction being sorted, 'asc' or 'desc'.

{{{

!php

fCRUD::printSortableColumn('name', 'Name'); }}}

would create the following HTML based on the page context

{{{

!html

Name

Name }}}

tag.description: The column to create the sortable header for

tag.name: param
tag.description: This will override the humanized version of the column

docblock.description: Checks to see if the user is from the IPs or IP ranges specified
docblock.long-description:
The $ip_ranges parameter can be either a single string, or an array of strings, each of which should be in one of the following formats:

  • A single IP address:
    • 192.168.1.1
    • 208.77.188.166
  • A CIDR range
    • 192.168.1.0/24
    • 208.77.188.160/28
  • An IP/subnet mask combination
    • 192.168.1.0/255.255.255.0
    • 208.77.188.160/255.255.255.240

tag.name: param
tag.description: A string (or array of strings) of the IPs or IP ranges to restrict to - see method description for details

tag.name: return
tag.description: If the user is coming from (one of) the IPs or ranges specified

docblock.description: Returns the approximate difference in time, discarding any unit of measure but the least specific.
docblock.long-description:
The output will read like:

  • "This time is {return value} the provided one" when a time it passed
  • "This time is {return value}" when no time is passed and comparing with the current time

Examples of output for a time passed might be:

  • '5 minutes after'
  • '2 hours before'
  • 'at the same time'

Examples of output for no time passed might be:

  • '5 minutes ago'
  • '2 hours ago'
  • 'right now'

You would never get the following output since it includes more than one unit of time measurement:

  • '5 minutes and 28 seconds'
  • '1 hour, 15 minutes'

Values that are close to the next largest unit of measure will be rounded up:

  • '55 minutes' would be represented as '1 hour', however '45 minutes' would not

tag.name: param
tag.description: The time to create the difference with, `NULL` is interpreted as now

tag.name: param
tag.description: When `TRUE`, the returned value will only include the difference in the two times, but not `from now`, `ago`, `after` or `before`

tag.name: return
tag.description: The fuzzy difference in time between the this time and the one provided

docblock.description: If this time is greater than the time passed

tag.name: param
tag.description: The time to compare with, `NULL` is interpreted as now

tag.name: return
tag.description: If this time is greater than the one passed

docblock.description: If this time is greater than or equal to the time passed

tag.name: param
tag.description: The time to compare with, `NULL` is interpreted as now

tag.name: return
tag.description: If this time is greater than or equal to the one passed

docblock.description: If this time is less than the time passed

tag.name: param
tag.description: The time to compare with, `NULL` is interpreted as today

tag.name: return
tag.description: If this time is less than the one passed

docblock.description: If this time is less than or equal to the time passed

tag.name: param
tag.description: The time to compare with, `NULL` is interpreted as today

tag.name: return
tag.description: If this time is less than or equal to the one passed

docblock.description: Modifies the current time, creating a new fTime object
docblock.long-description:
The purpose of this method is to allow for easy creation of a time based on this time. Below are some examples of formats to modify the current time:

  • '17:i:s' to set the hour of the time to 5 PM
  • 'H:00:00'` to set the time to the beginning of the current hour

tag.name: param
tag.description: The current time will be formatted with this string, and the output used to create a new object

tag.name: return
tag.description: The new time

docblock.description: Provides request-related methods
docblock.long-description:
This class is implemented to use the UTF-8 character encoding. Please see http://flourishlib.com/docs/UTF-8 for more information.

Please also note that using this class in a PUT or DELETE request will cause the php://input stream to be consumed, and thus no longer available.

docblock.description: Returns a request token that should be placed in each HTML form to prevent [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cross-site_request_forgery cross-site request forgery]
docblock.long-description:
This method will return a random 15 character string that should be placed in a hidden input element on every HTML form. When the form contents are being processed, the token should be retrieved and passed into ::validateCSRFToken().

The value returned by this method is stored in the session and then checked by the validate method, which helps prevent cross site request forgeries and (naive) automated form submissions.

Tokens generated by this method are single use, so a user must request the page that generates the token at least once per submission.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The URL to generate a token for, default to the current page

tag.name: return
tag.description: The token to be submitted with the form

docblock.description: Gets a value from the `DELETE`/`PUT` post data, `$_POST` or `$_GET` superglobals (in that order)
docblock.long-description:
A value that exactly equals '' and is not cast to a specific type will become NULL.

Valid $cast_to types include: - 'string' - 'binary' - 'int' - 'integer' - 'bool' - 'boolean' - 'array' - 'date' - 'time' - 'timestamp'

It is possible to append a ? to a data type to return NULL whenever the $key was not specified in the request, or if the value was a blank string.

The array and unspecified $cast_to types allow for multi-dimensional arrays of string data. It is possible to cast an input value as a single-dimensional array of a specific type by appending [] to the $cast_to.

All string, array or unspecified $cast_to will result in the value(s) being interpreted as UTF-8 string and appropriately cleaned of invalid byte sequences. Also, all low-byte, non-printable characters will be stripped from the value. This includes all bytes less than the value of 32 (Space) other than Tab (\t), Newline (\n) and Cariage Return (\r).

To preserve low-byte, non-printable characters, or get the raw value without cleaning invalid UTF-8 byte sequences, plase use the value of binary for the $cast_to parameter.

Any integers that are beyond the range of 32bit storage will be returned as a string. The returned value can be forced to always be a real integer, which may cause truncation of the value, by passing integer! as the $cast_to.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The key to get the value of - array elements can be accessed via `[sub-key]` syntax

tag.name: param
tag.description: Cast the value to this data type - see method description for details

tag.name: param
tag.description: If the parameter is not set in the `DELETE`/`PUT` post data, `$_POST` or `$_GET`, use this value instead. This value will get cast if a `$cast_to` is specified.

tag.name: param
tag.description: If the request value is a blank string and `$default_value` is specified, this flag will cause the `$default_value` to be returned

tag.name: return
tag.description: The value

docblock.description: Returns the HTTP `Accept-Language`s sorted by their `q` values (from high to low)

tag.name: return
tag.description: An associative array of `{language} => {q value}` sorted (in a stable-fashion) from highest to lowest `q` - if no header was sent, an empty array will be returned

docblock.description: Returns the HTTP `Accept` types sorted by their `q` values (from high to low)

tag.name: return
tag.description: An associative array of `{type} => {q value}` sorted (in a stable-fashion) from highest to lowest `q` - if no header was sent, an empty array will be returned

docblock.description: Returns the best HTTP `Accept-Language` (based on `q` value) - can be filtered to only allow certain languages
docblock.long-description: Special conditions affecting the return value: - If no $filter is provided and the client does not send the Accept-Language header, NULL will be returned - If no $filter is provided and the client specifies * with the highest q, NULL will be returned - If $filter contains one or more values, but the Accept-Language header does not match any, FALSE will be returned - If $filter contains one or more values, but the client does not send the Accept-Language header, the first entry from $filter will be returned - If $filter contains two or more values, and two of the values have the same q value, the one listed first in $filter will be returned

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of languages that are valid to return - these should be in the form `{language}-{territory}`, e.g. `en-us`

tag.name: param
tag.description: |$language A language that is valid to return

tag.name: return
tag.description: The best language listed in the `Accept-Language` header - see method description for edge cases

docblock.description: Gets a value from the `DELETE`/`PUT` post data, `$_POST` or `$_GET` superglobals (in that order), restricting to a specific set of values

docblock.description: Forces use as a static class
An [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Active_record_pattern active record pattern] base class
docblock.long-description: This class uses fORMSchema to inspect your database and provides an OO interface to a single database table. The class dynamically handles method calls for getting, setting and other operations on columns. It also dynamically handles retrieving and storing related records.

docblock.description: Caches callbacks for methods
An array of flags indicating a class has been configured
Maps objects via their primary key
Caches method name parsings
Keeps track of the recursive call level of replication so we can clear the map
Keeps a list of records that have been replicated
Contains a list of what columns in each class need to be unescaped and what data type they are
A data store for caching data related to a record, the structure of this is completely up to the developer using it
The old values for this record
docblock.long-description: Column names are the keys, but a column key will only be present if a value has changed. The value associated with each key is an array of old values with the first entry being the oldest value. The static methods ::assign(), ::changed(), ::hasOld() and ::retrieveOld() are the best way to interact with this array.

docblock.description: Records that are related to the current record via some relationship
docblock.long-description: This array is used to cache related records so that a database query is not required each time related records are accessed. The fORMRelated class handles most of the interaction with this array.

docblock.description: The values for this record
docblock.long-description: This array always contains every column in the database table as a key with the value being the current value.

docblock.description: Sets a value to the `$values` array, preserving the old value in `$old_values`

tag.description: The column to set

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value to set

docblock.description: Handles all method calls for columns, related records and hook callbacks
docblock.long-description:
Dynamically handles get, set, prepare, encode and inspect methods for each column in this record. Method names are in the form verbColumName().

This method also handles associate, build, count, has, and link verbs for records in many-to-many relationships; build, count, has and populate verbs for all related records in one-to-many relationships and create, has and populate verbs for all related records in one-to-one relationships, and the create verb for all related records in many-to-one relationships.

Method callbacks registered through fORM::registerActiveRecordMethod() will be delegated via this method.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the method called

tag.name: param
tag.description: The parameters passed

tag.name: return
tag.description: The value returned by the method called

docblock.description: Creates a clone of a record
docblock.long-description: If the record has an auto incrementing primary key, the primary key will be erased in the clone. If the primary key is not auto incrementing, the primary key will be left as-is in the clone. In either situation the clone will return FALSE from the ::exists() method until ::store() is called.

docblock.description: Creates a new record or loads one from the database - if a primary key or unique key is provided the record will be loaded

docblock.description: Retrieves a value from the record and prepares it for output into an HTML form element.
docblock.long-description:
Below are the transformations performed:

  • varchar, char, text: will run through fHTML::encode(), if TRUE is passed the text will be run through fHTML::convertNewLinks() and fHTML::makeLinks()
  • float: takes 1 parameter to specify the number of decimal places
  • date, time, timestamp: format() will be called on the fDate/fTime/fTimestamp object with the 1 parameter specified
  • objects: the object will be converted to a string by __toString() or a (string) cast and then will be run through fHTML::encode()
  • all other data types: the value will be run through fHTML::encode()

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the column to retrieve

tag.name: param
tag.description: The formatting string

tag.name: return
tag.description: The encoded value for the column specified

docblock.description: Sets the values for this record by getting values from the request through the fRequest class

tag.name: return
tag.description: The record object, to allow for method chaining

docblock.description: Retrieves a value from the record and prepares it for output into html.
docblock.long-description:
Below are the transformations performed:

  • varchar, char, text: will run through fHTML::prepare(), if TRUE is passed the text will be run through fHTML::convertNewLinks() and fHTML::makeLinks()
  • boolean: will return 'Yes' or 'No'
  • integer: will add thousands/millions/etc. separators
  • float: will add thousands/millions/etc. separators and takes 1 parameter to specify the number of decimal places
  • date, time, timestamp: format() will be called on the fDate/fTime/fTimestamp object with the 1 parameter specified
  • objects: the object will be converted to a string by __toString() or a (string) cast and then will be run through fHTML::prepare()

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the column to retrieve

tag.name: param
tag.description: The formatting parameter, if applicable

tag.name: return
tag.description: The formatted value for the column specified

docblock.description: Generates the method signatures for all methods (including dynamic ones)

tag.name: param
tag.description: If the doc block comments for each method should be included

tag.name: return
tag.description: An associative array of method name => method signature

docblock.description: Generates a clone of the current record, removing any auto incremented primary key value and allowing for replicating related records
docblock.long-description:
This method will accept three different sets of parameters:

  • No parameters: this object will be cloned
  • A single TRUE value: this object plus all many-to-many associations and all child records (recursively) will be cloned
  • Any number of plural related record class names: the many-to-many associations or child records that correspond to the classes specified will be cloned

The class names specified can be a simple class name if there is only a single route between the two corresponding database tables. If there is more than one route between the two tables, the class name should be substituted with a string in the format 'RelatedClass{route}'.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The plural related class to replicate - see method description for details

tag.name: return
tag.description: The cloned record

tag.description: The value to set

tag.name: return
tag.description: This record, to allow for method chaining

tag.description: The record object, to allow for method chaining

tag.name: return
tag.description: If $return_messages is TRUE, an array of validation messages will be returned

docblock.description: Columns that should be treated as case insensitive when checking uniqueness
Conditional rules
Ordering rules for messages
One or more rules
Only one rules
Regular expression replacements performed on each message
Rules that require at least one or more *-to-many related records to be associated
Rules that require a value to match a regular expression
Rules that require a value be present in a column even if the database schema doesn't require it
String replacements performed on each message
Valid values rules
Adds a conditional rule
docblock.long-description: If a non-empty value is found in one of the $main_columns, or if specified, a value from the $conditional_values array, all of the $conditional_columns will also be required to have a value.

tag.description: The class name or instance of the class this rule applies to

tag.name: param
tag.description: The column(s) to check for a value

tag.name: param
tag.description: If `NULL`, any value in the main column will trigger the conditional column(s), otherwise the value must match this scalar value or be present in the array of values

tag.name: param
tag.description: The column(s) that are to be required

docblock.description: Adds a call to [http://php.net/preg_replace `preg_replace()`] for each message
docblock.long-description:
Regex replacement is done after the post::validate() hook, and right before the messages are reordered.

If a message is an empty string after replacement, it will be removed from the list of messages.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The class name or instance of the class the columns exists in

tag.name: param
tag.description: The PCRE regex to search for - see http://php.net/pcre for details

tag.name: param
tag.description: The string to replace with - all $ and \ are used in back references and must be escaped with a \ when meant literally

docblock.description: Adds a rule to validate a column against a PCRE regular expression - the rule is not run if the value is `NULL`

tag.name: param
tag.description: The class name or instance of the class the columns exists in

tag.name: param
tag.description: The column to match with the regex

tag.name: param
tag.description: The PCRE regex to match against - see http://php.net/pcre for details

tag.name: param
tag.description: The message to use if the value does not match the regular expression

docblock.description: Requires that a column have a non-`NULL` value
docblock.long-description: Before using this method, try setting the database column to NOT NULL and remove any default value. Such a configuration will trigger the same functionality as this method, and will enforce the rule on the database level for any other code that queries it.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The class name or instance of the class the column(s) exists in

tag.name: param
tag.description: The column or columns to check - each column will require a value

docblock.description: Adds a call to [http://php.net/str_replace `str_replace()`] for each message
docblock.long-description:
String replacement is done after the post::validate() hook, and right before the messages are reordered.

If a message is an empty string after replacement, it will be removed from the list of messages.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The class name or instance of the class the columns exists in

tag.name: param
tag.description: The string to search for

tag.name: param
tag.description: The string to replace with

docblock.description: Restricts a column to having only a value from the list of valid values
docblock.long-description:
Please note that NULL values are always allowed, even if not listed in the $valid_values array, if the column is not set as NOT NULL.

This functionality can also be accomplished by added a CHECK constraint on the column in the database, or using a MySQL ENUM data type.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The class name or instance of the class this rule applies to

tag.name: param
tag.description: The column to validate

tag.name: param
tag.description: The valid values to check - `NULL` values are always allows if the column is not set to `NOT NULL`

docblock.description: Checks to see if a columns has a value, but based on the schema and if the column allows NULL
docblock.long-description:
If the columns allows NULL values, than anything other than NULL will be returned as TRUE. If the column does not allow NULL and the value is anything other than the "empty" value for that data type, then TRUE will be returned.

The values that are considered "empty" for each data type are as follows. Please note that there is no "empty" value for dates, times or timestamps.

  • Blob: ''
  • Boolean: FALSE
  • Float: 0.0
  • Integer: 0
  • String: ''

tag.name: param
tag.description: The schema object for the table

tag.name: param
tag.description: The class the column is part of

tag.name: param
tag.description: &$values An associative array of all values for the record

tag.name: param
tag.description: The column to check

tag.name: return
tag.description: An error message for the rule

docblock.description: Set the format to be applied to all field names used in fValidationExceptions
docblock.long-description:
The format should contain exactly one %s [http://php.net/sprintf sprintf()] conversion specification, which will be replaced with the field name. Any literal % characters should be written as %%.

The default format is just %s:, which simply inserts a : and space after the field name.

tag.name: param
tag.description: A string to format the field name with - `%s` will be replaced with the field name

docblock.description: Sets the message for the exception, allowing for custom formatting beyond fException
docblock.long-description:
If this method receives exactly two parameters, a string and an array, the string will be used as a message in a HTML <p> tag and the array will be turned into an unorder list <ul> tag with each element in the array being an <li> tag. It is possible to pass an optional exception code as a third parameter.

The following PHP:

{{{

!php

throw new fValidationException( 'The following problems were found:', array( 'Please provide your name', 'Please provide your email address' ) ); }}}

Would create the message:

{{{

!text/html

The following problems were found:

  • Please provide your name
  • Please provide your email address

}}}

If the parameters are anything else, they will be passed to fException::__construct().

tag.name: param
tag.description:
The beginning message for the exception. This will be placed in a `

` tag.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of strings to place in a `<ul>` tag

tag.name: param
tag.description: The optional exception code

docblock.long-description: This operation will be reverted by a filesystem transaction being rolled back.

tag.description: The contents to write to the file, must be a non-NULL value to be written

docblock.description: Determines the file's mime type by either looking at the file contents or matching the extension
docblock.long-description: Please see the ::getMimeType() description for details about how the mime type is determined and what mime types are detected.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The file to check the mime type for - must be a valid filesystem path if no `$contents` are provided, otherwise just a filename

tag.name: param
tag.description: The first 4096 bytes of the file content - the `$file` parameter only need be a filename if this is provided

tag.name: return
tag.description: The mime type of the file

tag.description: The first 4 bytes of the file content to use for byte checking

tag.name: param
tag.description: The extension of the filetype, only used for difficult files such as Microsoft office documents

tag.name: return
tag.description: The mime type of the file

docblock.long-description: If multiple fFile objects are created for a single file, they will reflect changes in each other including rename and delete actions.

tag.name: param

tag.name: param
tag.description: If file checks should be skipped, which improves performance, but may cause undefined behavior - only skip these if they are duplicated elsewhere

docblock.long-description: If a filesystem transaction is in progress and is rolled back, this data will be removed.
