docblock.description: Deletes the current file
docblock.long-description: This operation will NOT be performed until the filesystem transaction has been committed, if a transaction is in progress. Any non-Flourish code (PHP or system) will still see this file as existing until that point.

docblock.description: Creates a new file object with a copy of this file
docblock.long-description:
If no directory is specified, the file is created with a new name in the current directory. If a new directory is specified, you must also indicate if you wish to overwrite an existing file with the same name in the new directory or create a unique name.

This operation will be reverted by a filesystem transaction being rolled back.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The directory to duplicate the file into if different than the current directory

tag.name: param
tag.description: If a new directory is specified, this indicates if a file with the same name should be overwritten.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The new fFile object

docblock.description: Gets the file extension

tag.name: return
tag.description: The extension of the file

docblock.description: Gets the file's mime type
docblock.long-description:
This method will attempt to look at the file contents and the file extension to determine the mime type. If the file contains binary information, the contents will be used for mime type verification, however if the contents appear to be plain text, the file extension will be used.

The following mime types are supported. All other binary file types will be returned as application/octet-stream and all other text files will be returned as text/plain.

Archive:

  • application/x-bzip2 BZip2 file
  • application/x-compress Compress (*nix) file
  • application/x-gzip GZip file
  • application/x-rar-compressed Rar file
  • application/x-stuffit StuffIt file
  • application/x-tar Tar file
  • application/zip Zip file

Audio:

  • audio/x-flac FLAC audio
  • audio/mpeg MP3 audio
  • audio/mp4 MP4 (AAC) audio
  • audio/vorbis Ogg Vorbis audio
  • audio/x-wav WAV audio
  • audio/x-ms-wma Windows media audio

Document:

  • application/vnd.ms-excel Excel (2000, 2003 and 2007) file
  • application/pdf PDF file
  • application/vnd.ms-powerpoint Powerpoint (2000, 2003, 2007) file
  • text/rtf RTF file
  • application/msword Word (2000, 2003 and 2007) file

Image:

  • image/x-ms-bmp BMP file
  • application/postscript EPS file
  • image/gif GIF file
  • application/vnd.microsoft.icon ICO file
  • image/jpeg JPEG file
  • image/png PNG file
  • image/tiff TIFF file
  • image/svg+xml SVG file

Text:

  • text/css CSS file
  • text/csv CSV file
  • text/html (X)HTML file
  • text/calendar iCalendar file
  • application/javascript Javascript file
  • application/x-perl Perl file
  • application/x-httpd-php PHP file
  • application/x-python Python file
  • application/rss+xml RSS feed
  • application/x-ruby Ruby file
  • text/tab-separated-values TAB file
  • text/x-vcard VCard file
  • application/xhtml+xml XHTML (Real) file
  • application/xml XML file

Video/Animation:

  • video/x-msvideo AVI video
  • application/x-shockwave-flash Flash movie
  • video/x-flv Flash video
  • video/x-ms-asf Microsoft ASF video
  • video/mp4 MP4 video
  • video/ogg OGM and Ogg Theora video
  • video/quicktime Quicktime video
  • video/x-ms-wmv Windows media video

tag.name: return
tag.description: The mime type of the file

docblock.description: Returns the last modification time of the file

tag.name: return
tag.description: The timestamp of when the file was last modified

docblock.long-description: The return value may be incorrect for files over 2GB on 32-bit OSes.

docblock.description: Returns the current one-based line number (required by iterator interface)

tag.name: throws
tag.description: When there are no remaining lines in the file

tag.name: return
tag.description: The current line number

docblock.description: Moves the current file to a different directory
docblock.long-description:
Please note that ::rename() will rename a file in its directory or rename it into a different directory.

If the current file's filename already exists in the new directory and the overwrite flag is set to false, the filename will be changed to a unique name.

This operation will be reverted if a filesystem transaction is in progress and is later rolled back.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: When the directory passed is not a directory or is not readable

tag.name: param
tag.description: The directory to move this file into

tag.name: param
tag.description: If the current filename already exists in the new directory, `TRUE` will cause the file to be overwritten, `FALSE` will cause the new filename to change

tag.name: return
tag.description: The file object, to allow for method chaining

docblock.description: Advances to the next line in the file (required by iterator interface)

tag.name: throws
tag.description: When there are no remaining lines in the file

docblock.description: Prints the contents of the file
docblock.long-description:
This method is primarily intended for when PHP is used to control access to files.

Be sure to close the session, if open, to prevent performance issues. Any open output buffers are automatically closed and discarded.

tag.name: param
tag.description: If HTTP headers for the file should be included

tag.name: param
tag.description: Present the file as an attachment instead of just outputting type headers - if a string is passed, that will be used for the filename, if `TRUE` is passed, the current filename will be used

tag.name: return
tag.description: The file object, to allow for method chaining

docblock.description: Reads the data from the file
docblock.long-description:
Reads all file data into memory, use with caution on large files!

This operation will read the data that has been written during the current transaction if one is in progress.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The data to write to the file

tag.name: return
tag.description: The contents of the file

docblock.description: Renames the current file
docblock.long-description:
If the filename already exists and the overwrite flag is set to false, a new filename will be created.

This operation will be reverted if a filesystem transaction is in progress and is later rolled back.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The new full path to the file or a new filename in the current directory

tag.name: param
tag.description: If the new filename already exists, `TRUE` will cause the file to be overwritten, `FALSE` will cause the new filename to change

tag.name: return
tag.description: The file object, to allow for method chaining

tag.name: return
tag.description: If the iterator is still valid

docblock.description: Writes the provided data to the file
docblock.long-description:
Requires all previous data to be stored in memory if inside a transaction, use with caution on large files!

If a filesystem transaction is in progress and is rolled back, the previous data will be restored.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The file object, to allow for method chaining

Sets a cookie to be sent back to the browser - uses default parameters set by the other set methods of this class
docblock.long-description:
The following methods allow for setting default parameters for this method:

  • ::setDefaultExpires(): Sets the default for the $expires parameter
  • ::setDefaultPath(): Sets the default for the $path parameter
  • ::setDefaultDomain(): Sets the default for the $domain parameter
  • ::setDefaultSecure(): Sets the default for the $secure parameter
  • ::setDefaultHTTPOnly(): Sets the default for the $httponly parameter

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value of the cookie to set

tag.description: The domain this cookie applies to

tag.description: If the cookie should only be readable by HTTP connection, not javascript

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b17 Internal Backwards Compatiblity Break - changed the array keys for translated queries returned from ::translate() to include a number plus `:` before the original SQL, preventing duplicate keys [wb, 2010-07-14]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b16 Added IBM DB2 support [wb, 2010-04-13]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b15 Fixed a bug with MSSQL national character conversion when running a SQL statement with a sub-select containing joins [wb, 2009-12-18]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b14 Changed PostgreSQL to cast columns in LOWER() calls to VARCHAR to allow UUID columns (which are treated as a VARCHAR by fSchema) to work with default primary key ordering in fRecordSet [wb, 2009-12-16]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b13 Added a parameter to ::enableCaching() to provide a key token that will allow cached values to be shared between multiple databases with the same schema [wb, 2009-10-28]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b12 Backwards Compatibility Break - Removed date translation functionality, changed the signature of ::translate(), updated to support quoted identifiers, added support for PostgreSQL, MSSQL and Oracle schemas [wb, 2009-10-22]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b11 Fixed a bug with translating MSSQL national columns over an ODBC connection [wb, 2009-09-18]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b10 Changed last bug fix to support PHP 5.1.6 [wb, 2009-09-18]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b9 Fixed another bug with parsing table aliases for MSSQL national columns [wb, 2009-09-18]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b8 Fixed a bug with parsing table aliases that occurs when handling MSSQL national columns [wb, 2009-09-09]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b7 Fixed a bug with translating `NOT LIKE` operators in PostgreSQL [wb, 2009-07-15]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b6 Changed replacement values in preg_replace() calls to be properly escaped [wb, 2009-06-11]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b5 Update code to only translate data types inside of `CREATE TABLE` queries [wb, 2009-05-22]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b4 Added the missing ::__get() method for callback support [wb, 2009-05-06]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b3 Added Oracle and caching support, various bug fixes [wb, 2009-05-04]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b2 Fixed a notice with SQLite foreign key constraints having no `ON` clauses [wb, 2009-02-21]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b The initial implementation [wb, 2007-09-25]

parse_markers.notice: Parameter $component could not be found in compose()
Parameter could not be found in compose()

docblock.description: Takes a subset of SQL from IBM DB2, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, SQLite and MSSQL and translates into the various dialects allowing for cross-database code

tag.name: copyright
tag.description: Copyright (c) 2007-2011 Will Bond

tag.name: author
tag.description: Will Bond [wb] <will@flourishlib.com>

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b20 Added fix for PostgreSQL to handle `INSERT` statements that don't specify any columns or values [wb, 2011-09-06]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b19 Removed the stray method ::removeSQLiteIndexes() that was left over from moving code into fSQLSchemaTranslation [wb, 2011-05-17]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b18 Fixed `LENGTH()` and `SUBSTR()` functions for non-ascii characters being stored in MySQL, SQLite and DB2, moved `CREATE TABLE` support to fSQLSchemaTranslation [wb, 2011-05-09]

docblock.description: The fCache object to cache schema info and, optionally, translated queries to
The cache prefix to use for cache entries
The fDatabase instance
If debugging is enabled
Database-specific schema information needed for translation
An instance of fSQLSchemaTranslation for when DDL statements are run
docblock.long-description: This object is only loaded when needed since it is so large.

docblock.description: Composes text using fText if loaded

tag.name: param
tag.description: The message to compose

tag.name: param
tag.description: A string or number to insert into the message

tag.name: return
tag.description: The composed and possible translated message

docblock.description: Takes the `FROM` clause from ::parseSelectSQL() and returns all of the tables and each one's alias

tag.name: param
tag.description: The SQL `FROM` clause to parse

tag.name: return
tag.description: The tables in the `FROM` clause, in the format `{table_alias} => {table_name}`

docblock.description: Callback for custom SQLite function; calculates the cotangent of a number

tag.name: param
tag.description: The number to calculate the cotangent of

tag.name: return
tag.description: The contangent of `$x`

docblock.description: Callback for custom SQLite function; returns the current date

tag.name: return
tag.description: The current date

docblock.description: Callback for custom SQLite length function; returns the number of UTF-8 characters in a string

tag.name: param
tag.description: The string to measure

tag.name: return
tag.description: The current date

docblock.description: Callback for custom SQLite function; calculates the log to a specific base of a number

tag.name: param
tag.description: The base for the log calculation

tag.name: param
tag.description: The number to calculate the logarithm of

tag.name: return
tag.description: The logarithm of `$num` to `$base`

docblock.description: Callback for custom SQLite function; returns the sign of the number

tag.name: param
tag.description: The number to change the sign of

tag.name: return
tag.description: `-1` if a negative sign, `0` if zero, `1` if positive sign

docblock.description: Callback for custom SQLite function; creates a substring

tag.name: param
tag.description: The string to take a substring of

tag.name: param
tag.description: The one-based position to start the substring at

tag.name: param
tag.description: The length of the substring to take

tag.name: return
tag.description: The substring

docblock.description: Callback for custom SQLite function; returns the current time

tag.name: return
tag.description: The current time

docblock.description: Callback for custom SQLite function; returns the current timestamp

tag.name: return
tag.description: The current date

docblock.description: Sets up the class and creates functions for SQLite databases

tag.name: param
tag.description: The database being translated for

docblock.description: All requests that hit this method should be requests for callbacks

tag.name: param
tag.description: The method to create a callback for

tag.name: return
tag.description: The callback for the method requested

docblock.description: Clears all of the schema info out of the object and, if set, the fCache object
Adds a number of math functions to SQLite that MSSQL, MySQL and PostgreSQL have by default
Sets the schema info to be cached to the fCache object specified

tag.name: param
tag.description: The cache to cache to

docblock.description: Sets if debug messages should be shown

tag.name: param
tag.description: If debugging messages should be shown

docblock.description: Fixes pulling unicode data out of national data type MSSQL columns

tag.name: param
tag.description: The SQL to fix

tag.name: return
tag.description: The fixed SQL

docblock.description: Fixes empty string comparisons in Oracle

tag.name: param
tag.description: The SQL to fix

tag.name: return
tag.description: The fixed SQL

docblock.description: Creates a unique cache prefix to help prevent cache conflicts

tag.name: return
tag.description: The cache prefix to use

docblock.description: Translates Flourish SQL into the dialect for the current database

tag.name: param
tag.description: The SQL statements to translate

tag.name: param
tag.description: &$rollback_statements SQL statements to rollback the returned SQL statements if something goes wrong - only applicable for MySQL `ALTER TABLE` statements

tag.name: return
tag.description: The translated SQL statements all ready for execution. Statements that have been translated will have string key of the number, `:` and the original SQL, all other will have a numeric key.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The SQL to translate

tag.name: return
tag.description: The translated SQL

tag.description: The SQL to translate

tag.name: return
tag.description: The translated SQL

tag.name: param
tag.description: The SQL to translate

tag.name: return
tag.description: The translated SQL

tag.description: The SQL to fix

docblock.description: Gets schema information for the selected database

tag.name: copyright
tag.description: Copyright (c) 2007-2012 Will Bond

tag.name: author
tag.description: Will Bond [wb] <will@flourishlib.com>

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b51 Fixed handling of getting tables in table creation order when a table references itself, fixed default value detection for the last column in a MySQL table [wb, 2012-01-12]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b50 Fixed detection of explicitly named SQLite foreign key constraints [wb, 2011-08-23]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b49 Added support for spatial/geometric data types in MySQL and PostgreSQL [wb, 2011-05-26]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b48 Fixed a bug with ::getTables() not working on MySQL 4.x, fixed ::getKeys() to always return a reset array [wb, 2011-05-24]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b47 Backwards Compatibility Break - ::getTables(), ::getColumnInfo(), ::getDatabases(), ::getKeys() and ::getRelationships() now return database, schema, table and column names in lowercase, added the `$creation_order` parameter to ::getTables(), fixed bugs with getting column and key information from MSSQL, Oracle and SQLite [wb, 2011-05-09]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b46 Enhanced SQLite schema detection to cover situations where `UNIQUE` constraints are defined separately from the table and when comments are used in `CREATE TABLE` statements [wb, 2011-02-06]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b45 Fixed Oracle auto incrementing detection to work with `INSERT OR UPDATE` triggers, fixed detection of dynamic default date/time/timestamp values for DB2 and Oracle [wb, 2010-12-04]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b44 Fixed the list of valid elements for ::getColumnInfo() [wb, 2010-11-28]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b43 Added the `comment` element to the information returned by ::getColumnInfo() [wb, 2010-11-28]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b42 Fixed a bug with MySQL detecting default `ON DELETE` clauses [wb, 2010-10-19]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b41 Fixed handling MySQL table names that require quoting [wb, 2010-08-24]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b40 Fixed bugs in the documentation and error message of ::getColumnInfo() about what are valid elements [wb, 2010-07-21]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b39 Fixed a regression where key detection SQL was not compatible with PostgreSQL 8.1 [wb, 2010-04-13]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b38 Added Oracle support to ::getDatabases() [wb, 2010-04-13]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b37 Fixed ::getDatabases() for MSSQL [wb, 2010-04-09]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b36 Fixed PostgreSQL to properly report explicit `NULL` default values via ::getColumnInfo() [wb, 2010-03-30]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b35 Added `max_length` values for various text and blob data types across all databases [wb, 2010-03-29]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b34 Added `min_value` and `max_value` attributes to ::getColumnInfo() to specify the valid range for numeric columns [wb, 2010-03-16]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b33 Changed it so that PostgreSQL unique indexes containing functions are ignored since they can't be properly detected at this point [wb, 2010-03-14]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b32 Fixed ::getTables() to not include views for MySQL [wb, 2010-03-14]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b31 Fixed the creation of the default caching key for ::enableCaching() [wb, 2010-03-02]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b30 Fixed the class to work with lower privilege Oracle accounts and added detection of Oracle number columns [wb, 2010-01-25]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b29 Added on_delete and on_update elements to one-to-one relationship info retrieved by ::getRelationships() [wb, 2009-12-16]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b28 Fixed a bug with detecting some multi-column unique constraints in SQL Server databases [wb, 2009-11-13]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b27 Added a parameter to ::enableCaching() to provide a key token that will allow cached values to be shared between multiple databases with the same schema [wb, 2009-10-28]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b26 Added the placeholder element to the output of ::getColumnInfo(), added support for PostgreSQL, MSSQL and Oracle "schemas", added support for parsing quoted SQLite identifiers [wb, 2009-10-22]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b25 One-to-one relationships utilizing the primary key as a foreign key are now properly detected [wb, 2009-09-22]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b24 Fixed MSSQL support to work with ODBC database connections [wb, 2009-09-18]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b23 Fixed a bug where one-to-one relationships were being listed as many-to-one [wb, 2009-07-21]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b22 PostgreSQL UNIQUE constraints that are created as indexes and not table constraints are now properly detected [wb, 2009-07-08]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b21 Added support for the UUID data type in PostgreSQL [wb, 2009-06-18]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b20 Add caching of merged info, improved performance of ::getColumnInfo() [wb, 2009-06-15]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b19 Fixed a couple of bugs with ::setKeysOverride() [wb, 2009-06-04]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b18 Added missing support for MySQL mediumint columns [wb, 2009-05-18]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b17 Fixed a bug with ::clearCache() not properly reseting the tables and databases list [wb, 2009-05-13]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b16 Backwards Compatibility Break - ::setCacheFile() changed to ::enableCaching() and now requires an fCache object, ::flushInfo() renamed to ::clearCache(), added Oracle support [wb, 2009-05-04]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b15 Added support for the three different types of identifier quoting in SQLite [wb, 2009-03-28]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b14 Added support for MySQL column definitions containing the COLLATE keyword [wb, 2009-03-28]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b13 Fixed a bug with detecting PostgreSQL columns having both a CHECK constraint and a UNIQUE constraint [wb, 2009-02-27]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b12 Fixed detection of multi-column primary keys in MySQL [wb, 2009-02-27]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b11 Fixed an issue parsing MySQL tables with comments [wb, 2009-02-25]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b10 Added the ::getDatabases() method [wb, 2009-02-24]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b9 Now detects unsigned and zerofill MySQL data types that do not have a parenthetical part [wb, 2009-02-16]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b8 Mapped the MySQL data type `'set'` to `'varchar'`, however valid values are not implemented yet [wb, 2009-02-01]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b7 Fixed a bug with detecting MySQL timestamp columns [wb, 2009-01-28]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b6 Fixed a bug with detecting MySQL columns that accept `NULL` [wb, 2009-01-19]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b5 ::setColumnInfo(): fixed a bug with not grabbing the real database schema first, made general improvements [wb, 2009-01-19]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b4 Added support for MySQL binary data types, numeric data type options unsigned and zerofill, and per-column character set definitions [wb, 2009-01-17]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b3 Fixed detection of the data type of MySQL timestamp columns, added support for dynamic default date/time values [wb, 2009-01-11]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b2 Fixed a bug with detecting multi-column unique keys in MySQL [wb, 2009-01-03]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b The initial implementation [wb, 2007-09-25]

docblock.description: Finds the one-to-one, many-to-one, one-to-many and many-to-many relationships in the database
Returns column information for the table specified
docblock.long-description:
If only a table is specified, column info is in the following format:

{{{ array( (string) {column name} => array( 'type' => (string) {data type}, 'placeholder' => (string) {fDatabase::escape() placeholder for this data type}, 'not_null' => (boolean) {if value can't be null}, 'default' => (mixed) {the default value}, 'valid_values' => (array) {the valid values for a varchar field}, 'max_length' => (integer) {the maximum length in a varchar field}, 'min_value' => (numeric) {the minimum value for an integer/float field}, 'max_value' => (numeric) {the maximum value for an integer/float field}, 'decimal_places' => (integer) {the number of decimal places for a decimal/numeric/money/smallmoney field}, 'auto_increment' => (boolean) {if the integer primary key column is a serial/autoincrement/auto_increment/indentity column}, 'comment' => (string) {the SQL comment/description for the column} ), ... ) }}}

If a table and column are specified, column info is in the following format:

{{{ array( 'type' => (string) {data type}, 'placeholder' => (string) {fDatabase::escape() placeholder for this data type}, 'not_null' => (boolean) {if value can't be null}, 'default' => (mixed) {the default value-may contain special strings CURRENT_TIMESTAMP, CURRENT_TIME or CURRENT_DATE}, 'valid_values' => (array) {the valid values for a varchar field}, 'max_length' => (integer) {the maximum length in a char/varchar field}, 'min_value' => (fNumber) {the minimum value for an integer/float field}, 'max_value' => (fNumber) {the maximum value for an integer/float field}, 'decimal_places' => (integer) {the number of decimal places for a decimal/numeric/money/smallmoney field}, 'auto_increment' => (boolean) {if the integer primary key column is a serial/autoincrement/auto_increment/indentity column}, 'comment' => (string) {the SQL comment/description for the column} ) }}}

If a table, column and element are specified, returned value is the single element specified.

The 'type' element is homogenized to a value from the following list:

  • 'varchar'
  • 'char'
  • 'text'
  • 'integer'
  • 'float'
  • 'timestamp'
  • 'date'
  • 'time'
  • 'boolean'
  • 'blob'

Please note that MySQL reports boolean data types as tinyint(1), so all tinyint(1) columns will be listed as boolean. This can be fixed by calling:

{{{

!php

$schema->setColumnInfoOverride( array( 'type' => 'integer', 'placeholder' => '%i', 'default' => {default integer}, 'min_value' => new fNumber(-128), 'max_value' => new fNumber(127) ), '{table name}', '{column name}' ); }}}

The 'comment' element pulls from the database's column comment facility with the exception of MSSQL and SQLite.

For MSSQL, the comment is pulled from the MS_Description extended property, which can be added via the Description field in SQL Server Management Studio, or via the sp_addextendedproperty stored procedure.

For SQLite, the comment is extracted from any SQL comment that is placed at the end of the line on which the column is defined:

{{{

!sql

CREATE TABLE users ( user_id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT, name VARCHAR(200) NOT NULL -- This is the full name ); }}}

For the SQLite users table defined above, the name column will have the comment This is the full name.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The table to get the column info for

tag.name: param
tag.description: The column to get the info for

tag.name: param
tag.description: The element to return: `'type'`, `'placeholder'`, `'not_null'`, `'default'`, `'valid_values'`, `'max_length'`, `'min_value'`, `'max_value'`, `'decimal_places'`, `'auto_increment'`, `'comment'`

tag.name: return
tag.description: The column info for the table/column/element specified - see method description for format

docblock.description: Returns a list of primary key, foreign key and unique key constraints for the table specified
docblock.long-description:
The structure of the returned array is:

{{{ array( 'primary' => array( {column name}, ... ), 'unique' => array( array( {column name}, ... ), ... ), 'foreign' => array( array( 'column' => {column name}, 'foreign_table' => {foreign table name}, 'foreign_column' => {foreign column name}, 'on_delete' => {the ON DELETE action: 'no_action', 'restrict', 'cascade', 'set_null', or 'set_default'}, 'on_update' => {the ON UPDATE action: 'no_action', 'restrict', 'cascade', 'set_null', or 'set_default'} ), ... ) ) }}}

tag.name: param
tag.description: The table to return the keys for

tag.name: param
tag.description: The type of key to return: `'primary'`, `'foreign'`, `'unique'`

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array of all keys, or just the type specified - see method description for format

docblock.description: Returns a list of one-to-one, many-to-one, one-to-many and many-to-many relationships for the table specified
docblock.long-description:
The structure of the returned array is:

{{{ array( 'one-to-one' => array( array( 'table' => (string) {the name of the table this relationship is for}, 'column' => (string) {the column in the specified table}, 'related_table' => (string) {the related table}, 'related_column' => (string) {the related column}, 'on_delete' => (string) {the ON DELETE action: 'no_action', 'restrict', 'cascade', 'set_null', or 'set_default'}, 'on_update' => (string) {the ON UPDATE action: 'no_action', 'restrict', 'cascade', 'set_null', or 'set_default'} ), ... ), 'many-to-one' => array( array( 'table' => (string) {the name of the table this relationship is for}, 'column' => (string) {the column in the specified table}, 'related_table' => (string) {the related table}, 'related_column' => (string) {the related column} ), ... ), 'one-to-many' => array( array( 'table' => (string) {the name of the table this relationship is for}, 'column' => (string) {the column in the specified table}, 'related_table' => (string) {the related table}, 'related_column' => (string) {the related column}, 'on_delete' => (string) {the ON DELETE action: 'no_action', 'restrict', 'cascade', 'set_null', or 'set_default'}, 'on_update' => (string) {the ON UPDATE action: 'no_action', 'restrict', 'cascade', 'set_null', or 'set_default'} ), ... ), 'many-to-many' => array( array( 'table' => (string) {the name of the table this relationship is for}, 'column' => (string) {the column in the specified table}, 'related_table' => (string) {the related table}, 'related_column' => (string) {the related column}, 'join_table' => (string) {the table that joins the specified table to the related table}, 'join_column' => (string) {the column in the join table that references 'column'}, 'join_related_column' => (string) {the column in the join table that references 'related_column'}, 'on_delete' => (string) {the ON DELETE action: 'no_action', 'restrict', 'cascade', 'set_null', or 'set_default'}, 'on_update' => (string) {the ON UPDATE action: 'no_action', 'restrict', 'cascade', 'set_null', or 'set_default'} ), ... ) ) }}}

tag.name: param
tag.description: The table to return the relationships for

tag.name: param
tag.description: The type of relationship to return: `'one-to-one'`, `'many-to-one'`, `'one-to-many'`, `'many-to-many'`

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array of all relationships, or just the type specified - see method description for format

docblock.description: Merges the column info with the column info override
Merges the keys with the keys override
Allows overriding of column info
docblock.long-description:
Performs an array merge with the column info detected from the database.

To erase a whole table, set the $column_info to NULL. To erase a column, set the $column_info for that column to NULL.

If the $column_info parameter is not NULL, it should be an associative array containing one or more of the following keys. Please see ::getColumnInfo() for a description of each. - 'type' - 'placeholder' - 'not_null' - 'default' - 'valid_values' - 'max_length' - 'min_value' - 'max_value' - 'decimal_places' - 'auto_increment' - 'comment'

The following keys may be set to NULL: - 'not_null' - 'default' - 'valid_values' - 'max_length' - 'min_value' - 'max_value' - 'decimal_places' - 'comment'

The key 'auto_increment' should be a boolean.

The 'type' key should be one of: - 'blob' - 'boolean' - 'char' - 'date' - 'float' - 'integer' - 'text' - 'time' - 'timestamp' - 'varchar'

tag.name: param
tag.description: The modified column info - see method description for format

tag.name: param
tag.description: The table to override

tag.name: param
tag.description: The column to override

docblock.description: Allows overriding of key info. Replaces existing info, so be sure to provide full key info for type selected or all types.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The modified keys - see ::getKeys() for format

tag.name: param
tag.description: The table to override

tag.name: param
tag.description: The key type to override: `'primary'`, `'foreign'`, `'unique'`

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b27 Backwards Compatibility Break - changed the parameter order in ::crop() from `$crop_from_x`, `$crop_from_y`, `$new_width`, `$new_height` to `$new_width`, `$new_height`, `$crop_from_x`, `$crop_from_y` - added `$horizontal_position` and `$vertical_position` parameters to ::cropToRatio() [wb-imarc, 2010-11-09]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b26 Fixed a bug where processing via ImageMagick was not properly setting the default RGB colorspace [wb, 2010-10-19]

tag.name: changes

tag.name: changes

tag.name: changes

docblock.description: Sets the image to be resized proportionally to a specific size canvas
docblock.long-description: Will only size down an image. This method uses resampling to ensure the resized image is smooth in appearance. Resizing does not occur until ::saveChanges() is called.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The width of the canvas to fit the image on, `0` for no constraint

tag.name: param
tag.description: The height of the canvas to fit the image on, `0` for no constraint

docblock.long-description: Rotation does not occur until ::saveChanges() is called.

docblock.description: Saves any changes to the image
docblock.long-description:
If the file type is different than the current one, removes the current file once the new one is created.

This operation will be reverted by a filesystem transaction being rolled back. If a transaction is in progress and the new image type causes a new file to be created, the old file will not be deleted until the transaction is committed.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The new file format for the image: 'NULL` (no change), `'jpg'`, `'gif'`, `'png'`

tag.name: param
tag.description: The quality setting to use for JPEG images - this may be ommitted

tag.name: param
tag.description: If an existing file with the same name and extension should be overwritten

tag.name: return
tag.description: The image object, to allow for method chaining

docblock.description: Provides encoding and decoding for JSON
docblock.long-description:
This class is a compatibility class for the [http://php.net/json json extension] on servers with PHP 5.0 or 5.1, or servers with the json extension compiled out.

This class will handle JSON values that are not contained in an array or object - such values are not valid according to the JSON spec, but the functionality is included for compatiblity with the json extension.

tag.name: copyright
tag.description: Copyright (c) 2008-2010 Will Bond

tag.name: author
tag.description: Will Bond [wb] <will@flourishlib.com>

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b6 Removed `e` flag from preg_replace() calls [wb, 2010-06-08]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b5 Added the ::output() method [wb, 2010-03-15]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b4 Fixed a bug with ::decode() where JSON objects could lose all but the first key: value pair [wb, 2009-05-06]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b3 Updated the class to be consistent with PHP 5.2.9+ for encoding and decoding invalid data [wb, 2009-05-04]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b2 Changed @ error suppression operator to `error_reporting()` calls [wb, 2009-01-26]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b The initial implementation [wb, 2008-07-12]

docblock.description: An array of `{method} => {callback}` mappings for fActiveRecord
Cache for repetitive computation
Custom mappings for class -> database
Custom mappings for class <-> table
Custom column names for columns in fActiveRecord classes
Tracks callbacks registered for various fActiveRecord hooks
Callbacks for ::callInspectCallbacks()
Callbacks for ::objectify()
Custom record names for fActiveRecord classes
An array of `{method} => {callback}` mappings for fRecordSet
Callbacks for ::callReflectCallbacks()
A cache for resolving related class names for fActiveRecord classes in a PHP 5.3 namespace
Callbacks for ::replicate()
Callbacks for ::scalarize()
Calls the hook callbacks for the class and hook specified

tag.name: param
tag.description: The instance of the class to call the hook for

tag.name: param
tag.description: The hook to call

tag.name: param
tag.description: &$values The current values of the record

tag.name: param
tag.description: &$old_values The old values of the record

tag.name: param
tag.description: &$related_records Records related to the current record

tag.name: param
tag.description: &$cache The cache array of the record

tag.name: param
tag.description: &$parameter The parameter to send the callback

docblock.description: Takes a table and turns it into a class name - uses custom mapping if set

tag.name: param
tag.description: The table name

tag.name: return
tag.description: The class name

docblock.description: Will dynamically create an fActiveRecord-based class for a database table
docblock.long-description:
Normally this would be called from an __autoload() function.

This method will only create classes for tables in the default ORM database.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the class to create

docblock.description: Enables caching on the fDatabase, fSQLTranslation and fSchema objects used for the ORM
docblock.long-description:
This method will cache database schema information to the three objects that use it during normal ORM operation: fDatabase, fSQLTranslation and fSchema. To allow for schema changes without having to manually clear the cache, all cached information will be cleared if any fUnexpectedException objects are thrown.

This method should be called right after fORMDatabase::attach().

tag.name: param
tag.description: The object to cache schema information to

tag.name: param
tag.description: The database to enable caching for

tag.name: param
tag.description: This is a token that is used in cache keys to prevent conflicts for server-wide caches - when non-NULL the document root is used

docblock.description: Returns a matching callback for the class and method specified
docblock.long-description:
The callback returned will be determined by the following logic:

  1. If an exact callback has been defined for the method, it will be returned
  2. If a callback in the form {prefix}* has been defined that matches the method, it will be returned
  3. NULL will be returned

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the class

tag.name: param
tag.description: The method to get the callback for

tag.name: return
tag.description: The callback for the method or `NULL` if none exists - see method description for details

docblock.description: Takes a class name or class and returns the class name

tag.name: param
tag.description: The object to get the name of, or possibly a string already containing the class

tag.name: return
tag.description: The class name

docblock.description: Returns the column name
docblock.long-description: The default column name is the result of calling fGrammar::humanize() on the column.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The class name the column is part of

tag.name: param
tag.description: The database column

tag.name: return
tag.description: The column name for the column specified

docblock.description: Returns the name for the database used by the class specified

tag.name: param
tag.description: The class name to get the database name for

tag.name: return
tag.description: The name of the database to use

docblock.description: Returns the record name for a class
docblock.long-description: The default record name is the result of calling fGrammar::humanize() on the class.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The class name to get the record name of

tag.name: return
tag.description: The record name for the class specified

docblock.description: Returns a matching callback for the method specified
docblock.long-description:
The callback returned will be determined by the following logic:

  1. If an exact callback has been defined for the method, it will be returned
  2. If a callback in the form {action}* has been defined that matches the method, it will be returned
  3. NULL will be returned

tag.name: param
tag.description: The method to get the callback for

tag.name: return
tag.description: The callback for the method or `NULL` if none exists - see method description for details

tag.name: param
tag.description: The related class name

tag.description: The related class name, with the appropriate namespace prefix

docblock.description: Sets a class to use a database other than the "default"
docblock.long-description: Multiple database objects can be attached for the ORM by passing a unique $name to the ::attach() method.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the class, or an instance of it

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name given to the database when passed to ::attach()

docblock.description: Allows non-standard class to table mapping
docblock.long-description: By default, all database tables are assumed to be plural nouns in underscore_notation and all class names are assumed to be singular nouns in UpperCamelCase. This method allows arbitrary class to table mapping.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the class, or an instance of it

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the database table

tag.description: The class name of the class the column is part of

tag.name: param
tag.description: The database column

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value to possibly objectify

tag.name: return
tag.description: The scalar or object version of the value, depending on the column type and column options

docblock.description: Allows overriding of default column names
docblock.long-description: By default a column name is the result of fGrammar::humanize() called on the column.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The class name or instance of the class the column is located in

tag.name: param
tag.description: The database column

tag.name: param

docblock.long-description: By default a record name is the result of fGrammar::humanize() called on the class.

tag.description: The class name or instance of the class to override the name of

tag.name: param
tag.description: The human version of the record

docblock.description: Parses a `camelCase` method name for an action and subject in the form `actionSubject()`

tag.name: param
tag.description: The method name to parse

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array of `0 => {action}, 1 => {subject}`

docblock.description: Registers a callback for an fActiveRecord method that falls through to fActiveRecord::__call() or hits a predefined method hook
docblock.long-description:
The callback should accept the following parameters:

  • $object: The fActiveRecord instance
  • &$values: The values array for the record
  • &$old_values: The old values array for the record
  • &$related_records: The related records array for the record
  • &$cache: The cache array for the record
  • $method_name: The method that was called
  • &$parameters: The parameters passed to the method

tag.name: param
tag.description: The class name or instance of the class to register for, `'*'` will register for all classes

tag.name: param
tag.description: The method to hook for - this can be a complete method name or `{prefix}*` where `*` will match any column name

tag.name: param
tag.description: The callback to execute - see method description for parameter list

docblock.description: Registers a callback for one of the various fActiveRecord hooks - multiple callbacks can be registered for each hook
docblock.long-description:
The method signature should include the follow parameters:

  • $object: The fActiveRecord instance
  • &$values: The values array for the record - see the [http://flourishlib.com/docs/fORM#values $values] documentation for details
  • &$old_values: The old values array for the record - see the [http://flourishlib.com/docs/fORM#old_values $old_values] documentation for details
  • &$related_records: The related records array for the record - see the [http://flourishlib.com/docs/fORM#related_records $related_records] documentation for details
  • &$cache: The cache array for the record - see the [http://flourishlib.com/docs/fORM#cache $cache] documentation for details

The 'pre::validate()' and 'post::validate()' hooks have an extra parameter:

  • &$validation_messages: An ordered array of validation errors that will be returned or tossed as an fValidationException - see the [http://flourishlib.com/docs/fORM#validation_messages $validation_messages] documentation for details

The 'pre::replicate()', 'post::replicate()' and 'cloned::replicate()' hooks have an extra parameter:

  • $replication_level: An integer representing the level of recursion - the object being replicated will be 0, children will be 1, grandchildren 2 and so on.

Below is a list of all valid hooks:

  • 'post::__construct()'
  • 'pre::delete()'
  • 'post-begin::delete()'
  • 'pre-commit::delete()'
  • 'post-commit::delete()'
  • 'post-rollback::delete()'
  • 'post::delete()'
  • 'post::loadFromIdentityMap()'
  • 'post::loadFromResult()'
  • 'pre::populate()'
  • 'post::populate()'
  • 'pre::replicate()'
  • 'post::replicate()'
  • 'cloned::replicate()'
  • 'pre::store()'
  • 'post-begin::store()'
  • 'post-validate::store()'
  • 'pre-commit::store()'
  • 'post-commit::store()'
  • 'post-rollback::store()'
  • 'post::store()'
  • 'pre::validate()'
  • 'post::validate()'

tag.name: param
tag.description: The class name or instance of the class to hook, `'*'` will hook all classes

tag.name: param
tag.description: The hook to register for

tag.name: param
tag.description: The callback to register - see the method description for details about the method signature

docblock.description: Registers a callback to modify the results of fActiveRecord::inspect() methods

tag.name: param
tag.description: The class name or instance of the class to register for

tag.name: param
tag.description: The column to register for

tag.name: param
tag.description: The callback to register. Callback should accept a single parameter by reference, an associative array of the various metadata about a column.

docblock.description: Registers a callback for when ::objectify() is called on a specific column

tag.name: param
tag.description: The class name or instance of the class to register for

tag.name: param
tag.description: The column to register for

tag.name: param
tag.description: The callback to register. Callback should accept a single parameter, the value to objectify and should return the objectified value.

docblock.description: Registers a callback for an fRecordSet method that fall through to fRecordSet::__call()
docblock.long-description:
The callback should accept the following parameters:

  • $object: The actual record set
  • $class: The class of each record
  • &$records: The ordered array of fActiveRecord objects
  • $method_name: The method name that was called
  • $parameters: Any parameters passed to the method

tag.name: param
tag.description: The method to hook for

tag.name: param
tag.description: The callback to execute - see method description for parameter list

docblock.description: Registers a callback to modify the results of fActiveRecord::reflect()
docblock.long-description:
Callbacks registered here can override default method signatures and add method signatures, however any methods that are defined in the actual class will override these signatures.

The callback should accept three parameters:

  • $class: the class name
  • &$signatures: an associative array of {method_name} => {signature}
  • $include_doc_comments: a boolean indicating if the signature should include the doc comment for the method, or just the signature

tag.name: param
tag.description: The class name or instance of the class to register for, `'*'` will register for all classes

tag.name: param
tag.description: The callback to register. Callback should accept a three parameters - see method description for details.

docblock.description: Registers a callback for when a value is replicated for a specific column

tag.name: param
tag.description: The class name or instance of the class to register for

tag.name: param
tag.description: The column to register for

tag.name: param
tag.description: The callback to register. Callback should accept a single parameter, the value to replicate and should return the replicated value.

docblock.description: Registers a callback for when ::scalarize() is called on a specific column

tag.name: param
tag.description: The class name or instance of the class to register for

tag.name: param
tag.description: The column to register for

tag.name: param
tag.description: The callback to register. Callback should accept a single parameter, the value to scalarize and should return the scalarized value.

docblock.description: Takes and value and returns a copy is scalar or a clone if an object
docblock.long-description: The ::registerReplicateCallback() allows for custom replication code

tag.name: param
tag.description: The class the column is part of

tag.name: param
tag.description: The database column

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value to copy/clone

tag.name: return
tag.description: The copied/cloned value

docblock.description: Resets the configuration of the class
If the value passed is an object, calls `__toString()` on it

tag.name: param
tag.description: The class name or instance of the class the column is part of

tag.name: param
tag.description: The database column

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value to get the scalar value of

tag.name: return
tag.description: The scalar value of the value

docblock.description: Takes a class name (or class) and turns it into a table name - Uses custom mapping if set

tag.name: param
tag.description: The class name

tag.name: return
tag.description: The table name

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b21 Fixed a bug in ::enableMinification() where the minification cache directory was sometimes not properly converted to a web path [wb, 2011-08-31]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b20 Fixed a bug in CSS minification that would reduce multiple zeros that are part of a hex color code, fixed minification of `+ ++` and similar constructs in JS [wb, 2011-08-31]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b19 Corrected a bug in ::enablePHPShortTags() that would prevent proper translation inside of HTML tag attributes [wb, 2011-01-09]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b18 Fixed a bug with CSS minification and black hex codes [wb, 2010-10-10]

tag.name: changes

tag.name: changes

tag.name: changes

tag.name: changes

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b8 Fixed a bug with placing absolute file paths on Windows [wb, 2010-07-09]

tag.name: changes

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b6 Changed ::set() and ::add() to return the object for method chaining, changed ::set() and ::get() to accept arrays of elements [wb, 2010-06-02]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b4 Added ::create() and ::retrieve() for named fTemplating instances [wb, 2010-05-11]

tag.name: changes
tag.description: 1.0.0b3 Fixed an issue with placing relative file path [wb, 2010-04-23]

docblock.description: Named fTemplating instances
The buffered object id, used for differentiating different instances when doing replacements

docblock.description: Enables buffered output, allowing ::set() and ::add() to happen after a ::place() but act as if they were done before
docblock.long-description:
Please note that using buffered output will affect the order in which code is executed since the elements are not actually ::place()'ed until the destructor is called.

If the non-template code depends on template code being executed sequentially before it, you may not want to use output buffering.

docblock.description: Deletes an element from the template

tag.name: param
tag.description: The element to delete - array elements can be modified via `[sub-key]` syntax, and thus `[` and `]` can not be used in element names

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value to return if the `$element` is not set

tag.name: param
tag.description: |$elements The elements to delete - an array of element names or an associative array of keys being element names and the values being the default values

tag.name: return
tag.description: The value of the `$element` that was deleted - an associative array of deleted elements will be returned if an array of `$elements` was specified

docblock.description: Erases all output since the invocation of the template - only works if buffering is on
Enables minified output for CSS and JS elements
docblock.long-description:
For CSS and JS, compilation means that the file will be minified and cached. The filename will change whenever the content change, allowing for far-futures expire headers.

Please note that this option requires that all CSS and JS paths be relative to the $_SERVER['DOCUMENT_ROOT'] and start with a /. Also this class will not clean up old cached files out of the cache directory.

This functionality will be inherited by all child fTemplating objects that do not have their own explicit minification settings.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The compilation mode - `'development'` means that file modification times will be checked on each load, `'production'` means that the cache files will only be regenerated when missing

tag.name: param
tag.description: The directory to cache the compiled files into - this needs to be inside the document root or a path added to fFilesystem::addWebPathTranslation()

tag.name: param
tag.description: The directory to prepend to all CSS and JS paths to load the files from the filesystem - this defaults to `$_SERVER['DOCUMENT_ROOT']`

docblock.description: Converts PHP short tags to long tags when short tags are turned off
docblock.long-description:
Please note that this only affects PHP files that are directly evaluated with ::place() or ::inject(). It will not affect PHP files that have been evaluated via include or require statements inside of the directly evaluated PHP files.

This functionality will be inherited by all child fTemplating objects that do not have their own explicit short tag settings.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The compilation mode - `'development'` means that file modification times will be checked on each load, `'production'` means that the cache files will only be regenerated when missing

tag.name: param
tag.description: The directory to cache the compiled files into - this directory should not be accessible from the web

docblock.description: Minifies JS or CSS
docblock.long-description: For JS, this function is based on the JSMin algorithm (not the code) from http://www.crockford.com/javascript/jsmin.html with the addition of preserving /*! comment blocks for things like licenses. Some other versions of JSMin change the contents of special comment blocks, but this version does not.

docblock.description: Includes the element specified - element must be set through ::set() first
docblock.long-description:
If the element is a file path ending in .css, .js, .rss or .xml an appropriate HTML tag will be printed (files ending in .xml will be treated as an RSS feed). If the element is a file path ending in .inc, .php or .php5 it will be included.

Paths that start with ./ will be loaded relative to the current script. Paths that start with a file or directory name will be loaded relative to the $root passed in the constructor. Paths that start with / will be loaded from the root of the filesystem.

You can pass the media attribute of a CSS file or the title attribute of an RSS feed by adding an associative array with the following formats:

{{{ array( 'path' => (string) {css file path}, 'media' => (string) {media type} ); array( 'path' => (string) {rss file path}, 'title' => (string) {feed title} ); }}}

tag.name: param
tag.description: The element to place

docblock.description: Returns the approximate difference in time, discarding any unit of measure but the least specific.
docblock.long-description:
The output will read like:

  • "This date is {return value} the provided one" when a date it passed
  • "This date is {return value}" when no date is passed and comparing with today

Examples of output for a date passed might be:

  • '2 days after'
  • '1 year before'
  • 'same day'

Examples of output for no date passed might be:

  • '2 days from now'
  • '1 year ago'
  • 'today'

You would never get the following output since it includes more than one unit of time measurement:

  • '3 weeks and 1 day'
  • '1 year and 2 months'

Values that are close to the next largest unit of measure will be rounded up:

  • 6 days would be represented as 1 week, however 5 days would not
  • 29 days would be represented as 1 month, but 21 days would be shown as 3 weeks

tag.name: param
tag.description: The date to create the difference with, `NULL` is interpreted as today

tag.name: param
tag.description: When `TRUE`, the returned value will only include the difference in the two dates, but not `from now`, `ago`, `after` or `before`

tag.name: return
tag.description: The fuzzy difference in time between the this date and the one provided

tag.description: If this date is less than or equal to the one passed

docblock.description: Modifies the current date, creating a new fDate object
docblock.long-description:
The purpose of this method is to allow for easy creation of a date based on this date. Below are some examples of formats to modify the current date:

  • 'Y-m-01' to change the date to the first of the month
  • 'Y-m-t' to change the date to the last of the month
  • 'Y-\W5-N' to change the date to the 5th week of the year

tag.name: param
tag.description: The current date will be formatted with this string, and the output used to create a new object

tag.name: return
tag.description: The new date

Configures the SMTP connection
docblock.long-description:
The SMTP connection is only made once authentication is attempted or an email is sent.

Please note that this class will upgrade the connection to TLS via the SMTP STARTTLS command if possible, even if a secure connection was not requested. This helps to keep authentication information secure.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The hostname or IP address to connect to

tag.name: param
tag.description: The port number to use

tag.name: param
tag.description: If the connection should be secure - if `STARTTLS` is available, the connection will be upgraded even if this is `FALSE`

tag.name: param
tag.description: The timeout for the connection - defaults to the `default_socket_timeout` ini setting

The following opcode caches are currently detected:

  • [http://pecl.php.net/package/APC APC]
  • [http://eaccelerator.net eAccelerator]
  • [http://www.nusphere.com/products/phpexpress.htm Nusphere PhpExpress]
  • [http://turck-mmcache.sourceforge.net/index_old.html Turck MMCache]
  • [http://xcache.lighttpd.net XCache]
  • [http://www.zend.com/en/products/server/ Zend Server (Optimizer+)]
  • [http://www.zend.com/en/products/platform/ Zend Platform (Code Acceleration)]

docblock.description: Returns the approximate difference in time, discarding any unit of measure but the least specific.
docblock.long-description:
The output will read like:

  • "This timestamp is {return value} the provided one" when a timestamp it passed
  • "This timestamp is {return value}" when no timestamp is passed and comparing with the current timestamp

Examples of output for a timestamp passed might be:

  • '5 minutes after'
  • '2 hours before'
  • '2 days after'
  • 'at the same time'

Examples of output for no timestamp passed might be:

  • '5 minutes ago'
  • '2 hours ago'
  • '2 days from now'
  • '1 year ago'
  • 'right now'

You would never get the following output since it includes more than one unit of time measurement:

  • '5 minutes and 28 seconds'
  • '3 weeks, 1 day and 4 hours'

Values that are close to the next largest unit of measure will be rounded up:

  • '55 minutes' would be represented as '1 hour', however '45 minutes' would not
  • '29 days' would be represented as '1 month', but '21 days' would be shown as '3 weeks'

tag.name: param
tag.description: The timestamp to create the difference with, `NULL` is interpreted as now

tag.name: param
tag.description: When `TRUE`, the returned value will only include the difference in the two timestamps, but not `from now`, `ago`, `after` or `before`

tag.name: return
tag.description: The fuzzy difference in time between the this timestamp and the one provided

docblock.description: If this timestamp is greater than the timestamp passed

tag.name: param
tag.description: The timestamp to compare with, `NULL` is interpreted as now

tag.name: return
tag.description: If this timestamp is greater than the one passed

docblock.description: If this timestamp is greater than or equal to the timestamp passed

tag.name: param
tag.description: The timestamp to compare with, `NULL` is interpreted as now

tag.name: return
tag.description: If this timestamp is greater than or equal to the one passed

docblock.description: If this timestamp is less than the timestamp passed

tag.name: param
tag.description: The timestamp to compare with, `NULL` is interpreted as today

tag.name: return
tag.description: If this timestamp is less than the one passed

docblock.description: If this timestamp is less than or equal to the timestamp passed

tag.name: param
tag.description: The timestamp to compare with, `NULL` is interpreted as today

tag.name: return
tag.description: If this timestamp is less than or equal to the one passed

docblock.description: Modifies the current timestamp, creating a new fTimestamp object
docblock.long-description:
The purpose of this method is to allow for easy creation of a timestamp based on this timestamp. Below are some examples of formats to modify the current timestamp:

  • 'Y-m-01 H:i:s' to change the date of the timestamp to the first of the month:
  • 'Y-m-t H:i:s' to change the date of the timestamp to the last of the month:
  • 'Y-m-d 17:i:s' to set the hour of the timestamp to 5 PM:

tag.name: param
tag.description: The current timestamp will be formatted with this string, and the output used to create a new object. The format should **not** include the timezone (character `e`).

tag.name: param
tag.description: The timezone for the new object if different from the current timezone

tag.name: return
tag.description: The new timestamp

docblock.description: An array of fDatabase objects
If the PCRE engine supports unicode character properties
Allows attaching an fDatabase-compatible objects for by ORM code
docblock.long-description:
If a $name other than default is used, any fActiveRecord classes that should use it will need to be configured by passing the class name and $name to ::mapClassToDatabase(). The $name parameter should be unique per database or database master/slave setup.

The $role is used by code to allow for master/slave database setups. There can only be one database object attached for either of the roles, 'read' or 'write'. If the role 'both' is specified, it will be applied to both the 'read' and 'write' roles. Any sort of logic for picking one out of multiple databases should be done before this method is called.

docblock.description: Finds all of the table names in the SQL and creates the appropriate `FROM` and `GROUP BY` clauses with all necessary joins
docblock.long-description:
The SQL string should contain two placeholders, :from_clause and :group_by_clause, although the later may be omitted if necessary. All columns should be qualified with their full table name.

Here is an example SQL string to pass in presumming that the tables users and groups are in a relationship:

{{{ SELECT users.* FROM :from_clause WHERE groups.group_id = 5 :group_by_clause ORDER BY lower(users.first_name) ASC }}}

tag.name: param
tag.description: The database the query is to be executed on

tag.name: param
tag.description: The schema for the database

tag.name: param
tag.description: The parameters for the fDatabase::query() call

tag.name: param
tag.description: The main table to be queried

tag.name: return
tag.description: The params with the SQL `FROM` and `GROUP BY` clauses injected

docblock.description: Allows creating and sending a single email containing plaintext, HTML, attachments and S/MIME encryption
docblock.long-description:
Please note that this class uses the [http://php.net/function.mail mail()] function by default. Developers that are sending multiple emails, or need SMTP support, should use fSMTP with this class.

This class is implemented to use the UTF-8 character encoding. Please see http://flourishlib.com/docs/UTF-8 for more information.

docblock.description: A regular expression to match an email address, exluding those with comments and folding whitespace
docblock.long-description:
The matches will be:

  • [0]: The whole email address
  • [1]: The name before the @
  • [2]: The domain/ip after the @

constant.name: NAME_EMAIL_REGEX
constant.value: '~^[ \t]*( # Allow leading whitespace (?:[^\x00-\x20\(\)<>@,;:\\\\"\.\[\]]+[ \t]*|"[^"\\\\\n\r]+"[ \t]*) # An "atom" or a quoted string (?:\.?[ \t]*(?:[^\x00-\x20\(\)<>@,;:\\\\"\.\[\]]+[ \t]*|"[^"\\\\\n\r]+"[ \t]*))*) # Another "atom" or a quoted string or a . followed by one of those, any number of times [ \t]*<[ \t]*(( # The < encapsulating the email address (?:[^\x00-\x20\(\)<>@,;:\\\\"\.\[\]]+|"[^"\\\\\n\r]+") # An "atom" or a quoted string (?:\.[ \t]*(?:[^\x00-\x20\(\)<>@,;:\\\\"\.\[\]]+|"[^"\\\\\n\r]+"[ \t]*))* # A . plus another "atom" or a quoted string, any number of times )@( # The @ symbol (?:[a-z0-9\\-]+\.)+[a-z]{2,}| # Domain nam \[(?:(?:[01]?\d?\d|2[0-4]\d|25[0-5])\.){3}(?:[01]?\d?\d|2[0-4]\d|25[0-5])\] # (or) IP addresses ))[ \t]*>[ \t]*$~ixD'

docblock.description: A regular expression to match a `name <email>` string, exluding those with comments and folding whitespace
docblock.long-description:
The matches will be:

  • [0]: The whole name and email address
  • [1]: The name
  • [2]: The whole email address
  • [3]: The email username before the @
  • [4]: The email domain/ip after the @

docblock.description: Flags if the class should convert `\r\n` to `\n` for qmail. This makes invalid email headers that may work.

docblock.description: Adds a “related” file to the email, returning the `Content-ID` for use in HTML
docblock.long-description:
The purpose of a related file is to be able to reference it in part of the HTML body. Image src URLs can reference a related file by starting the URL with cid: and then inserting the Content-ID.

If a duplicate filename is detected, it will be changed to be unique.

docblock.description: A backtrace from when the file was deleted
The full path to the directory
Creates a directory on the filesystem and returns an object representing it
docblock.long-description:
The directory creation is done recursively, so if any of the parent directories do not exist, they will be created.

This operation will be reverted by a filesystem transaction being rolled back.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: When no directory was specified, or the directory already exists

tag.name: param
tag.description: The path to the new directory

tag.name: param
tag.description: The mode (permissions) to use when creating the directory. This should be an octal number (requires a leading zero). This has no effect on the Windows platform.

docblock.description: Check to see if the current directory is writable

tag.name: return
tag.description: If the directory is writable

docblock.description: Moves the current directory into a different directory
docblock.long-description:
Please note that ::rename() will rename a directory in its current parent directory or rename it into a different parent directory.

If the current directory's name already exists in the new parent directory and the overwrite flag is set to false, the name will be changed to a unique name.

This operation will be reverted if a filesystem transaction is in progress and is later rolled back.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: When the new parent directory passed is not a directory, is not readable or is a sub-directory of this directory

tag.name: param
tag.description: The directory to move this directory into

tag.name: param
tag.description: If the current filename already exists in the new directory, `TRUE` will cause the file to be overwritten, `FALSE` will cause the new filename to change

tag.name: return
tag.description: The directory object, to allow for method chaining

docblock.description: Renames the current directory
docblock.long-description: This operation will NOT be performed until the filesystem transaction has been committed, if a transaction is in progress. Any non-Flourish code (PHP or system) will still see this directory (and all contained files/dirs) as existing with the old paths until that point.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The new full path to the directory or a new name in the current parent directory

tag.name: param
tag.description: If the new dirname already exists, TRUE will cause the file to be overwritten, FALSE will cause the new filename to change

docblock.description: Performs a [http://php.net/scandir scandir()] on a directory, removing the `.` and `..` entries
docblock.long-description:
If the $filter looks like a valid PCRE pattern - matching delimeters (a delimeter can be any non-alphanumeric, non-backslash, non-whitespace character) followed by zero or more of the flags i, m, s, x, e, A, D, S, U, X, J, u - then [http://php.net/preg_match preg_match()] will be used.

Otherwise the $filter will do a case-sensitive match with * matching zero or more characters and ? matching a single character.

On all OSes (even Windows), directories will be separated by /s when comparing with the $filter.

tag.name: param
tag.description: A PCRE or glob pattern to filter files/directories by path - directories can be detected by checking for a trailing / (even on Windows)

tag.name: return
tag.description: The fFile (or fImage) and fDirectory objects for the files/directories in this directory

docblock.description: Performs a **recursive** [http://php.net/scandir scandir()] on a directory, removing the `.` and `..` entries

tag.name: param
tag.description: A PCRE or glob pattern to filter files/directories by path - see ::scan() for details

tag.name: return
tag.description: The fFile (or fImage) and fDirectory objects for the files/directories (listed recursively) in this directory

docblock.description: Throws an exception if the directory has been deleted
Provides a common API for different databases - will automatically use any installed extension
docblock.long-description:
This class is implemented to use the UTF-8 character encoding. Please see http://flourishlib.com/docs/UTF-8 for more information.

The following databases are supported:

  • [http://ibm.com/db2 DB2]
  • [http://microsoft.com/sql/ MSSQL]
  • [http://mysql.com MySQL]
  • [http://oracle.com Oracle]
  • [http://postgresql.org PostgreSQL]
  • [http://sqlite.org SQLite]

The class will automatically use the first of the following extensions it finds:

  • DB2
    • [http://php.net/ibm_db2 ibm_db2]
    • [http://php.net/pdo_ibm pdo_ibm]
  • MSSQL
    • [http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc296221.aspx sqlsrv]
    • [http://php.net/pdo_dblib pdo_dblib]
    • [http://php.net/mssql mssql] (or [http://php.net/sybase sybase])
  • MySQL
    • [http://php.net/mysql mysql]
    • [http://php.net/mysqli mysqli]
    • [http://php.net/pdo_mysql pdo_mysql]
  • Oracle
    • [http://php.net/oci8 oci8]
    • [http://php.net/pdo_oci pdo_oci]
  • PostgreSQL
    • [http://php.net/pgsql pgsql]
    • [http://php.net/pdo_pgsql pdo_pgsql]
  • SQLite
    • [http://php.net/pdo_sqlite pdo_sqlite] (for v3.x)
    • [http://php.net/sqlite sqlite] (for v2.x)

The odbc and pdo_odbc extensions are not supported due to character encoding and stability issues on Windows, and functionality on non-Windows operating systems.

tag.name: changes

docblock.description: Provides a common API for different databases - will automatically use any installed extension
docblock.long-description:
This class is implemented to use the UTF-8 character encoding. Please see http://flourishlib.com/docs/UTF-8 for more information.

The following databases are supported:

  • [http://ibm.com/db2 DB2]
  • [http://microsoft.com/sql/ MSSQL]
  • [http://mysql.com MySQL]
  • [http://oracle.com Oracle]
  • [http://postgresql.org PostgreSQL]
  • [http://sqlite.org SQLite]

The class will automatically use the first of the following extensions it finds:

  • DB2
    • [http://php.net/ibm_db2 ibm_db2]
    • [http://php.net/pdo_ibm pdo_ibm]
  • MSSQL
    • [http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc296221.aspx sqlsrv]
    • [http://php.net/pdo_dblib pdo_dblib]
    • [http://php.net/mssql mssql] (or [http://php.net/sybase sybase])
  • MySQL
    • [http://php.net/mysql mysql]
    • [http://php.net/mysqli mysqli]
    • [http://php.net/pdo_mysql pdo_mysql]
  • Oracle
    • [http://php.net/oci8 oci8]
    • [http://php.net/pdo_oci pdo_oci]
  • PostgreSQL
    • [http://php.net/pgsql pgsql]
    • [http://php.net/pdo_pgsql pdo_pgsql]
  • SQLite
    • [http://php.net/pdo_sqlite pdo_sqlite] (for v3.x)
    • [http://php.net/sqlite sqlite] (for v2.x)

The odbc and pdo_odbc extensions are not supported due to character encoding and stability issues on Windows, and functionality on non-Windows operating systems.

docblock.description: Escapes a value for insertion into SQL
docblock.long-description:
The valid data types are:

  • 'blob'
  • 'boolean'
  • 'date'
  • 'float'
  • 'identifier'
  • 'integer'
  • 'string' (also varchar, char or text)
  • 'varchar'
  • 'char'
  • 'text'
  • 'time'
  • 'timestamp'

In addition to being able to specify the data type, you can also pass in an SQL statement with data type placeholders in the following form:

  • %l for a blob
  • %b for a boolean
  • %d for a date
  • %f for a float
  • %r for an indentifier (table or column name)
  • %i for an integer
  • %s for a string
  • %t for a time
  • %p for a timestamp

Depending on what $sql_or_type and $value are, the output will be slightly different. If $sql_or_type is a data type or a single placeholder and $value is:

  • a scalar value - an escaped SQL string is returned
  • an array - an array of escaped SQL strings is returned

If $sql_or_type is a SQL string and $value is:

  • a scalar value - the escaped value is inserted into the SQL string
  • an array - the escaped values are inserted into the SQL string separated by commas

If $sql_or_type is a SQL string, it is also possible to pass an array of all values as a single parameter instead of one value per parameter. An example would look like the following:

{{{

!php

$db->escape( "SELECT * FROM users WHERE status = %s AND authorization_level = %s", array('Active', 'Admin') ); }}}

tag.name: param
tag.description: This can either be the data type to escape or an SQL string with a data type placeholder - see method description

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value to escape - both single values and arrays of values are supported, see method description for details

tag.name: return
tag.description: The escaped value/SQL or an array of the escaped values

docblock.description: Registers a callback for one of the various query hooks - multiple callbacks can be registered for each hook
docblock.long-description:
The following hooks are available: - 'unmodified': The original SQL passed to fDatabase, for prepared statements this is called just once before the fStatement object is created - 'extracted': The SQL after all non-empty strings have been extracted and replaced with ordered sprintf-style placeholders - 'run': After the SQL has been run

Methods for the 'unmodified' hook should have the following signature:

  • $database: The fDatabase instance
  • &$sql: The original, unedited SQL
  • &$values: The values to be escaped into the placeholders in the SQL

Methods for the 'extracted' hook should have the following signature:

  • $database: The fDatabase instance
  • &$sql: The SQL with all strings removed and replaced with %1$s-style placeholders
  • &$values: The values to be escaped into the placeholders in the SQL

The extracted hook is the best place to modify the SQL since there is no risk of breaking string literals. Please note that there may be empty strings ('') present in the SQL since some databases treat those as NULL.

Methods for the 'run' hook should have the following signature:

  • $database: The fDatabase instance
  • $query: The (string) SQL or array(0 => {fStatement object}, 1 => {values array})
  • $query_time: The (float) number of seconds the query took
  • $result The fResult or fUnbufferedResult object, or FALSE if no result

tag.name: param
tag.description: The hook to register for

tag.name: param
tag.description: The callback to register - see the method description for details about the method signature
